Summary: We got two rooms for our long overdue trip to Disneyland. Clean rooms, large,well-appointed bathrooms, great breakfast (a little bit of everything, including scrambled eggs and sausage). Anaheim Resort Transit was about a block away (picks up in front of the Peacock Suites on Anaheim Blvd.) and took us to Disney every day. You could walk, but I don't recommend it. You could drive, but parking at Disney is very expensive. Anyway, this property is well-managed, comfortable, clean, and more affordable than almost anything around it. Spending more might get you a little closer, but not much more.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  I am happy to hear that you had a pleasant stay.  I do hope that you get a chance to come and stay with us again.  Farzana

Summary: Outstanding location...excellent service.  Private shuttle for only three hotels to Disneyland and return.  Breakfast was one of the best I've ever seen.  Aside from the usual hot cereals, cold cereals, fruit, yogurt and pastries, there were do it yourself waffles and a different hot entree each day...i.e. one day was scrambled eggs and bacon and the next day we were served omelets and sausage. Parking is extra each night.  On same parking area is Buca di Peppo and across the street is a hamburger fast food place.  Down the street is a Target that sells Disneyland items for reasonable prices.  Great location and large clean rooms.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  I am glad you had a good time and we hope that you get a chance to come back again.  Farzana

Summary: LOVE this hotel, it's about a 5 min drive to the Disneyland park. We stay here every time we go to Disneyland. The rooms are VERY clean and the updated! The breakfast is perfect, the staff is amazing!!
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking time to comment about your recent stay with us.  I am happy to hear that we meant with all your expectations.  We look forward to having come back and stay again.  Farzana

Summary Heading: Comfort Inn & Suites, Anaheim, Great Place to Stay
Summary: This hotel is our family go to place when we need it in the Anaheim area. The rooms are clean and the hotel is very nice inside and out.  They also have breakfast available which makes it convenient when you are on the go. Great staff friendly and helpful.  The only issue I had on this trip was getting in the side door with my passkey, it didn't seem to want to work most of the time
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for staying with and I am glad you had a good time. Sorry about the side door but it is now fixed.  Farzana

Summary: Was very impressed with the facilities.  The staff were extremely friendly and very willing to assist in any way possible.  Never had any issues with room or staff.  Room was very quiet, (only real issue was the compressor on the AC vibrated loudly when unit first kicks on but quits when up to speed).  Our room was facing Disneyland so we were able to see the fireworks at night.  I would gladly spend my vacation there again.  Vicky and her staff only cleaned our room once while we were there but did an amazing job.  Kudos. If you are there for Disney or convention it is in a good location.  About 1 mile to walk but the ART picks up about .25 miles away and is outstanding to use.  $20 for a five day pass. My only real recommendation would be to try and get an ART stop closer to
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  I am glad that the staff was able to assist you.  I do hope that means you will be coming back and staying with us again when you are in the area.

Summary: We arrived a little early but our room was ready and they kindly allowed us to check in. Were helpful with information about local restaurants, directions etc.  explained that the fridge and microwave were turned off to save energy and told us how to turn them on. Bed extremely comfortable and although our room was next to the freeway, the noise was not too bad. Room really near the lift which was brilliant. The pool area is really nice and the jacuzzi lovely, shame the pool is not heated as we were too cissy to swim in the cold water and the weather was not too warm. Breakfast was OK. Would prefer proper cutlery and crockery rather than plastic and polystyrene but understand the labour saving reason. Would definitely recommend hotel as close to Disney and excellent value with
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for staying with us.  I am glad that the information you were given was helpful.  I do hope that the next time you come to the area you stay with us again.

Summary: It's located about 40 minutes in average traffic from LAX think we paid just over $100 dollars with tip for taxi. Hotel is last on a strip there's a little market a couple of doors down. A Cheesecake Factory a five minute walk along with bubba gumps and about 3 other restaurants and more being opening soon. There's also a little shopping centre with a handful of shop, o'neills, g stage (fab cheap women's clothes) Harley Davidson and a couple of others. Hotel check in was quick and easy, rooms were what you expect, clean and large bathroom. We did ask for a room overlooking the Disney fireworks as it was out honeymoon we thought this would be great but the receptionist just said ' your room has already been allocated' no attempt to see what see could rearrange! The safe is behind
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for staying with us.  I am happy to hear you liked everything we had to offer.  We look forward to serving your future lodging needs.

Summary Heading: Great hotel, walking distance of Disneyland
Summary: On arrival, a friendly greeting from knowledgeable staff set the tone for our stay in this great hotel. We had a large room with two large queen beds. The room had a fridge, microwave and  coffee maker.  There was a largish pool and a Jacuzzi. There was no launderette which surprised us for a hotel of its size. The car park was large, always with ample spaces to park, whatever time we got back to the hotel.  Disneyland was about a 35 minute steady walk, this increased or decreased depending how long we had to wait at the many crossings. Driving from the hotel to Disneyland is a bit complicated!  Breakfast is served from 6.30, so plenty of time to eat and get to the park for opening. There were sausage burgers and scrambled eggs in the hot section, English muffins and bread for
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for staying with us.  I am glad you had a good time and you will be back. I do want to recommend the Garden Walk next time you are in town as it is only a 10 minute walk. Once again thank you for staying with us we look forward to having you back soon.

Summary: Great stay, great accommodations, nice bedroom, nice attention, American breakfast is ok but closes at 11 am.  Parking spaces are not ok, car spaces are very small in between cars and got a car door hit and will pay $17 dlls per day.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for staying with us.  I am glad you liked the property and we look forward to serving your future lodging needs.

Summary: Hello tripadvisor and all of those who are going to read my comment we booked 2 rooms at confort inn 300 east katella for Christmas my wife myself and my two 6yrs old twins took room 305 my other 3 kids took room 306 on Dec. 24/14 around midnight my daughter found 3  roaches on the table and 1 on the wall next to the table immediately we called front office we told them abuot the problem the front office people didn't believe us it was a big argument that night, they switched my kids to a different room that night,  next day in the morning Dec. 25/15 my wife and I went to the front office and talked to the manager and explained her about the problem all we wanted was for them to check the room kill the roaches and fix the problem but some how the general manager was behind in
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  We are a very clean property as you can see from our reviews.  I understand your issue however we did try to settle it a pleasant matter.  We did do our best to work it out with you but we were not able too.  I am sorry it did not work out.

Summary: We had stayed at this hotel 2 times prior to this incident and didn't have a problem which is why we returned. Unfortunately during our Christmas vacation we had the worst experience ever. We found 2 cockroaches in the room. We were moved to another room and when we talked to a supervisor about how they should fix this problem she offered 10% off only for the night we had to move our stuff. While some employees were helpful, the manager was rude and disrespectful.When asked if we would get any compensation for the food we had to toss out, the manager came out and started being rude. We were treated as if we were the problem and the fact that they had cockroaches was completely ignored. She said we were lying and that we must have brought them. She threaten to kick us out and was
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  I understand your upset, however we did do our best to accommodate and help you. As you can clearly see from previous and new reviews we are a very clean hotel.  We definitely care about any and all issues.  We take all things seriously.  Even though we offered to move you and discount you seemed unhappy.  Unfortunately it is very hard to prove your compliant. Which is why we offered to move you.  Our goal is to help each and every guest as much as we possibly can. Since we were unable to do that you choose to leave which we felt was a better option.

Summary: Outstanding location, Close to Disneyland, bus/shuttle service outside the hotel, Great staff, could not do enough for us, free breakfast , make your own waffles, etc, rooms were roomy, restaurants all within walking distance, i felt safe at night.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  I am happy to hear that we were able to meet all your expectations.   We look forward to you coming back and staying with us again

Summary: The Room: Ask for the parking lot side.  ( Much quieter) Flat screen TV with HD Comfortable Bed Microwave/Refrigerator (Must flip switch under desk to turn on) Good shower  Running: Sidewalks are wide and you have several ways to go once you leave the hotel.  You have to be strategic with the crosswalks when you first leave the hotel or they will slow  you down.  Once you get over to Disney (.8miles) there are many different ways you can go.  (SEE PIC)  Katella is a long straight road with wide sidewalks, the palm trees shade it.  Lots of people watching while you run.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for staying with us and we hope to have you back soon.

Summary: The best thing about this place is the free parking and shuttle to Disney. The room was spacious and clean, which is greatly appreciated, but there were some issues I cannot overlook. First of all, my husband was sick, and I wanted to get him in the room as soon as possible and stated so upon check-in. It took awhile for them to find our pre-paid reservation, and once found, the employee would not accept my husband's credit card for incidentals because the reservation was in my name. I had to leave, go back to the car, and turn over the exact same credit card - same company, same numbers, same last name. Then she said we were on the first floor after my request clearly stated a high floor, please. After all the paper signing, she finally went into the back room to get our keys.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  I am sorry about the issues you experienced. However when we take cards from guest it must be the guest in front of us. This ensures that the person giving me something has a right to do so.  This protects the guest too.  Sorry about the room assignment but if we are sold out we try to accommodate each and every guest but we only have so many rooms on each floor.  I also believe we were sold out as well so that tends to make it hard. As for the sheets we can take care of that and thank you for that information.

Summary Heading: This is How All Hotels Should Be
Summary: My girlfriend and I were looking to find a reasonably priced hotel for 2 nights within LA before we fly home. Since we were driving, we didn’t mind to stay a bit further outside of downtown and give us the option to go to Disney if we want, though at the end we didn’t.  We were very happy with our stay in those 2 nights. The bed and towels were clean. Rooms were relatively quiet, the most you get is from people shutting their doors.  Reason why I say this is how every hotel should be is because as a traveller, all you want is a hotel room that is clean and good service, as you the room is important for washing up and sleeping. No matter if it’s a motel, inn, and hotel.   For a little over $100USD/night and with what’s included, such as wifi, parking, and breakfast. You feel this
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for deciding to stay with us.  I am happy to hear that it was worth the stay.  I hope that means next time you come to California you decided that we are your home away from home.

Summary: This was the second stop on my business trip in the area.  The hotel looks like it was maybe a converted Hampton Inn.  I arrived early and my room wasn’t ready as the clerk said they were booked up (not exactly un-friendly, but very “matter-of-factly”).  No problem.  I went to Downtown Disney to kill a few hours until they were ready.  When you exit the hotel, the only direction you can turn is right.  If you wish to go left, you have to turn right, go up a ways and make a u-turn.  However, if you’re going to Disney, you can turn right, go up and take the first left back onto the freeway and just follow the signs (very easy).  The same tricky entrance will come into play as you can't enter by making a left turn (plan accordingly). When I returned, I was promptly given a room.
Manager Response: Dear guest,  I am sorry you weren't able to check in early but you were able when you came back as our check in is 3pm.  Exiting and entering can be tricky as we only have one way in and out.  We keep the fridge off due to the fact we are unsure of what time a person may take the room.  Sorry for that inconvenience.  I am glad you had a pleasant stay and will return.

Summary: I attended a trade show and meetings at the nearby Anaheim Convention Center and stayed here for four nights. This hotel is close to both the convention center (within walking distance, if you don't mind a 15-20 min. stroll) and Disneyland. It's also close to River Walk at Anaheim (a collection of shops and restaurants), so you can walk or drive for shopping and dinner, if you like. Super comfy beds, very clean rooms, with mini fridges and microwaves. Breakfast was average, but included in the rate (although missing yogurt, which kind of had me bummed). I didn't use the fitness center or the pool, but they both looked very clean and neat. The staff was also very friendly and accomodating. I would stay here again. The only reason this hotel didn't get 5 stars: no water savings
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  I am glad to  hear that your stay was enjoyable. The location was great and the staff. Yeah!  Thanks for the tid bit about the water and we will look into it. We look forward to you coming back and staying again with us soon.

Summary: Our regular go to place was full and I had read the reviews and decided this sounded perfect- it more than exceeded our expectations- we had a wonderful stay.  It is right off the I-5 at Katella and we clocked the distance from the hotels entrance to the signal light at DL on Harbor- it was exactly 1.1 miles.  We had thought about taking the ART bus but decided to walk the next morning, I think it was as quick to walk as it would have been to take the ART and all level, an easy stroll.  The staff was delightful and the included breakfast the next morning was more than we expected; mini muffins, cereals, toast, batter for making waffles and more.  Saved time running around in the morning trying to have something before our 12 hour day in the parks.   Our room was very quiet and
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  I am so happy to hear that you loved the place.  I do hope that means that when you come to vacation in our area you and your family will come and stay with us again.

Summary Heading: Comfy and nice for the price
Summary: Writing this from my room as I'm on my last night. Super comfy beds. Nice room. Location from disneyland is a little tricky for getting there but what can you do. Breakfast was average. Would stay here again. You can here outside traffic from the room.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for staying with us.  I am glad you liked the rooms and the price.  We hope to have you back soon.

Summary: I stayed at comfort inn and suites in Anaheim, California from February 13th to the 16th and was over charged on my credit card that they had on file for "incidentals" by $434.00. My boyfriend and I bought Disneyland tickets through the hotel at that cost in cash and as they took our cash, they also charged my card and I was out that money all weekend. After being wrongfully treated by both the staff and the manager (Anna and Farzana) as well as having dirty sheets and not being able to sleep due to the sounds of the freeway, I asked for a refund for the cost of our stay (296.88). The manager was so unprofessional and even stuck her hand in my face and walked away in the middle of our conversation.  I will never ever stay at a place by this company again, as the hotel kept
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  I understand your issue.  I have spoke to all involved. We even investigated the issue with your card and no where in our system and even your banks system could not find an issue. You did pay cash there for your card was not used.  I understand that you even spoke to our main office and they tried to explain to you.  We did our best to explain the situation to you as with your bank and our main office.  I am not sure if you didn't understand but there was never any hold on your money and there was no refund to be done.  I hope this again helps in explaining any issue you had.  I do thank you for bringing it to our attention and I hope this helps.

Summary: My father, 4 year old daughter and I stayed here in February 2015 for our visit to Disneyland. Room was very clean, staff were exceptionally nice and accommodating, free breakfast was great, pool was good and location was easy to get to from the freeway for us tourists.  Less expensive than the hotels across from Disneyland but you need to take a shuttle bus or it's about a 1/2 hour walk.  Shuttle bus is a couple blocks away but works well - takes about 10 minutes to Disneland.  There isn't a tacky "parking charge" added on to the room price and they let us check in early so we had more time at Disneyland that day and they gave us a late checkout on checkout day (no extra fees) to accommodate my elderly father who didn't want to spend another whole day at Disneyland.   Only
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for staying with us. Thank you for the information regarding the water.  We will take care of that.  We appreciate when guest's tell us about their stay.  Other then that, I am glad you had a great time.  We hope that you can come back soon and stay again.

Summary: We really enjoyed our 6 night stay at this Comfort Inn.  The 2 rooms we had were both clean and comfortable.  The staff were very friendly and accommodating and the free breakfast offered enough to keep everyone in my family of 5 happy.  There is no restaurant there so we had to order in a lot.  We ate at 2 different pizza places recommended in the hotel information book and were terribly disappointed (Carolina's and Mary's Pizza).  Del Taco is right across the street. This hotel is a little out of the way from everything.  There is a shuttle you can take to Disneyland that is 5 minutes away.  Get clear directions from the front desk.  Would definitely stay here again :)
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you for taking time to comment about your recent stay with us.  I am sorry you didn't like the pizza. I like pizza hut.  Other then that you had a great time so that's good.  We hope that you do get a chance to come and stay again soon.

Summary: My experience at this hotel was very positive and exactly what I hoped/expected. I used this hotel as my base of operations for the Disney Rebel Challenge 10K and Half Marathon in January. As such, I was mainly at the hotel to sleep and recover after races and park exploration, so did not have time to sample the hotel's amenities such as pool and breakfast. That being said, the hotel was very clean and had a contemporary feel and provided an overall enjoyable experience. I requested a City View thanks to other recommendations on TravelAdvisor to be away from the freeway that runs alongside the other side of the hotel and had no noise concerns; I was not in the room at the right time to have a chance to see the Disney fireworks from this vantage point. The hotel offers
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for staying with us. I am glad you liked the property and didn't find it to far out.  Our location is centrally located to all of the surrounding facilities in the area. We work hard to make sure the property is clean and each and every guest feels like it is almost a home away from home.  We look for ward to having you come back and stay with us soon.

Summary: Very positive experience staying here. Great job by front desk staff. Room was clean, well furnished, quiet nights' sleep. Room could use some minor repairs to walls and carpet. Refrigerator in room is off and door open upon arrival; to use, I had to crawl under desk and turn on enable switch. Was sort of cooled down by the time I checked out. Consider it not usable if only staying for one night. Plenty of well-lit parking, good location near restaurants, shopping, and Disney, right next to the 5 Freeway. Will stay here again when in Anaheim.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for staying with us.  Sorry about the switch being under the desk. That is just the location.  We have them off to conserve energy.  Thank you for the info and we hope to have you back soon.

Summary: Could not fault the hotel for what we paid for it.The room was basic but clean and comfortable with a fridge and microwave in it you could also get free wifi.The hotel also has a pool as well.The breakfast was also good and plenty. Disney is in walking distance that is not to far but you can also catch a cab if you do not want to walk.The hotel also offers free parking. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful.We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  I am glad you had a pleasant stay.  The rooms was big enough for you all and it was comfortable.  We do hope that you get a chance to come back to the area and stay again.

Summary: Recently stayed at the comfort inn and suites for a training I was attending for a week in Orange. Hotel was very clean, the staff were friendly and the free breakfast in the morning was a definite plus! I attend trainings in Orange twice a year and I will definitely be booking here again.
Manager Response: Dear guest,  I am glad you liked the property and we come back.  We love repeat guests.  We look forward to serving your future lodging needs.

Summary: This hotel is over a mile from Disneyland but it is an easy walk in safe surroundings. There are shuttle buses and cabs to Disneyland if you don't want to walk. The staff are friendly, the rooms clean but the breakfast is pretty plain. Our room was on the highway side of the hotel but there really wasn't that much noise from the highway. The air conditioning made more noise than the road outside.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for staying with us.  I am glad you liked the room and we will check on the a/c.  Thanks for that.

Summary Heading: Great cheap hotel for disney stay.
Summary: We chose to stay here based on reviews, and it lived up to it. The hotel was very comfortable and very clean. The king bed was super comfortable, and the room was quite large with cable TV, and good WiFi. The free breakfast was a great way to start a big day of Disneyland, and it was actually edible food. The receptionist ladies were very helpful, and pleasant, even letting us check out late when my boyfriend lost his phone in our room. The only minor issue with the room is the fact that the rooms on the right side of the hall (as you exit the lift) have windows onto the freeway, which at times can be a bit loud, but it didn't really matter, as we spent minimal time in our room. The walk to Disneyland is about 20 minutes, but it is a very easy walk, and there are many dinner
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  I am happy to hear that we were able to live up to the reputation that others put on us.  I hope that means that when your in the area you come and stay with us each and every time.

Summary: We stayed at this hotel to be a base of operations to our visit to Disneyland and California Adventure Park for three days. The hotel is located about 20 minutes by foot to the Disneyland Park entrance -- certainly a little further away than most hotels.  Despite this, we stayed in a very clean and comfortable room. It featured a King Size bed, cable television, and a very decent private bathroom with shower and bath. Breakfast was provided to guests in the downstairs lobby area each morning, and provided guests with a basic buffet of eggs, sausages, toasts and cereals.   The staff were very accomodating and friendly and were able to assist with any request and were even able to rally the housekeeping staff to assist in the search for a missing mobile phone -- which was soon
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking time out to comment about your recent stay with us.  We love to hear what guest's have to say. I am glad your phone was found.  We hope that since you had a pleasant stay you'll be back.

Summary Heading: OK Stay-No managerial follow-up on problem
Summary: We stayed here twice this past month. The breakfast is nice enough for our needs, but starts at 630. You can hear traffic if you are on the highway side of the hotel. My first stay, the air conditioner broke-but we were pleased with speedy replacement of the unit by friendly staff. This last stay (over New Year's) the second night ,when I climbed into bed we noticed housekeeping had used stained sheets. It was kind of unsettling- not knowing what was on the sheets. It was late and I was tired. After three trips to the front desk, and 2 deliveries of wrong size sheets, I finally started making the bed with correct sheets- at which point some staff showed up to assist because I was pretty unhappy by then. The manager was gone until Monday-a note was being left for him. The
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for bringing your concerns to us.  I am not sure what happened with the miscommunication but I can assure you we will take care of it.  As for the sheets they should be changed daily and I am sure they were it just could have been some mistake.  That will be looked into as well.  I do you will reconsider and stay with us again.

Summary: We stayed here after Disney land and before an event at angel stadium. The location is good, near several places to eat and not far from Disney land. Rooms are clean and there is plenty of parking. Staff where not overall attentive but they did the job. Perfect for a short stay over.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,'  I did notice that you made a comment about the staff and I thank you for that. It helps us in knowing what things we may need to do to make each and every guest leave our property happy. We hope that you will stay again and soon.

Summary Heading: Just got back from DL :( - hotel is fine
Summary: Just wanted to chime in. This was the 2nd time my wife and I stayed in this hotel.   It continues to be a good choice for families and/or budget-wise travelers. The room was large enough, the bed was large and comfortable, the in-room fridge was great for freezing/cooling things for the next day at the Park, and the breakfast buffet was sufficient.   The only two 'major' downsides is that ART has relocated the stop that used to be behind the hotel and the AC Unit in our room was quite noisy.  As far as ART goes, it was an easy walk down the street and across to get to the Peacock Suites, where the stop is now located. We had good weather, in bad it'd be just far enough to get truly wet. Seriously though, an easy 10 minute walk - due to the crosswalks taking a long time to switch
Manager Response: Dear guest,  I thank you for commenting about your stay with us. It helps us to know what guest's think and what changes and improvements we may need to do.  I do appreciate your time and thank you again.

Summary: 1/7/15 this was a great experience. rooms lovely. staff so helpful and nice. Breakfast, so good we almost didn't get to Disneyland. This was my great nieces first trip and we wanted to have nice but affordable accommodations. We got great deal thru AAA.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  I am glad you liked the food, I do too. I am also happy to hear that your niece enjoyed her stay.  Since it was her first time I do hope this means you'll be back.

Summary: I really have nothing bad to say about this hotel. Upon arrival, there were lots of parking spaces, even at 11 o'clock at night. When entering the hotel, the staff was very friendly, and the hotel looked very clean. The rooms are very spacious, comfortable, and clean, as well as the bathrooms. They also came with a mini-fridge, microwave, AC, and heater, which was well appreciated. The wifi also worked very well in the rooms. Breakfast was included with the stay, and the selection was actually pretty good. Some choices included cereal, toast, muffins, pastries, egg, sausage, as well as belgian waffles, which you can make yourself with their belgian waffle makers (very easy to make and delicious). Drinks included juice, coffee, milk, water, etc. Nothing to really complain about
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking time to comment about your recent stay with us.  I am glad to hear that the property and it's content was to your liking.  I noticed no issues which makes me happy.  We hope that the next time you plan to come to the area we are your home away from home.

Summary Heading: Clean, quiet, good value for the money
Summary: Overall this is a great place to stay when you're going to Disneyland,  The room was clean, included a microwave and mini-fridge, as well as breakfast with the room rate (6:30-9:30am).  We were on bottom floor even though I had requested a higher one, but we did get checked in quickly by the friendly staff.  Had no problem with noise either from other guests or from the traffic outside.  Yes it is right near freeway but it really was just a little background noise nothing that bothered us at all.  The only bad thing is that the ART shuttle no longer stops right here.  Instead you have to walk 2 blocks (not horribly long ones) to get to Peacock Suites to catch it there.  There was one homeless lady talking to herself that we passed every day on way to shuttle but the area itself
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  I am glad you liked it and would choose to stay with us again.  We look forward to serving your future vacation plans.

Summary: I have had some bad experiences in lower-starred hotels in the States so I am very cautious about where I stay. I used the Express Deal portion on Priceline because the prices were amazing! It was a chance that I'm glad I took because this hotel was SO nice! It seems quite new, everything was clean and the staff were overly polite and helpful. I would not have rated this 2.5 stars - it's more along the lines of a 3.5 or 4 star hotel (yes, THAT good). The continental breakfast served each morning was good - there were scrambled eggs, sausages, make-your-own waffles, cereal, toast, hard-boiled eggs, a selection of baked goods (like danishes and muffins) juices and coffee/tea. It was quite convenient. Our rooms were spacious and had a microwave, a fridge, free wifi, and super comfy
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  I am glad we were better then you expected.  I do hope that means that each time you travel to this area we are your home away from home.

Summary: The stay was good. Rooms are clean and quite. It is not very near to disneyland, it is around 11 miles. But overall it is ok if you want to visit to disneyland and Catalina island. Breakfast was good. Parking was free. Overall it is recommended.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking time to comment about your recent stay. We hope to have you back soon.

Summary Heading: Miracles do happen - Cheap & Great at Disneyland
Summary: The service was 5 star by phone prior to arrival and throughout our stay.  We enjoyed a six night stay on the 5th floor in an odd numbered room so we overlooked fireworks each night.  We had a microwave, refrigerator, free Wi-Fi, very comfy bed, huge bathroom (shower had wonderful water pressure) and free breakfast!  We requested a room on the 'fireworks side' which they granted and waved the $10/night upgrade fee.  Breakfast included scrambled eggs, sausage patties, yogurt, hard-boiled eggs, various cereal, and pastries which was consistently replenished as necessary.  A short block & a half walk to Peacock Suites brings you to the ART shuttle (left out the front door, at the end of the block cross the street and continue to the right). I have already booked a return visit to
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for staying with us. I am so thrilled to hear that you will be coming back.  We look forward to seeing you soon.

Summary: Most hotels near Disneyland get you with extra costs for parking and WiFi, but this Comfort Inn doesn't have any surprises. It's one of the few, real values near the Happiest Place on Earth, and they even throw in a pretty decent (free) breakfast.   There's nothing fancy here, but the rooms are clean and spacious, and the staff was universally friendly. The free WiFi worked great, and the breakfast area is nice and large. It's just minutes from Disneyland and the freeway, and we had a great, quick stay.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for staying with us.  I am glad you liked the breakfast, so do I. We hope that you can come back soon.

Summary Heading: Short Stay for a visit to Disney Land
Summary: We have spent 3 nights at this convenient accommodation. Close to Disney Land and California Adventure Park. That is the best feature as the suites a dated and tired. However the room was clean and the bed was comfy. If you want a reasonable cost and short stay with breakfast included then this is satisfactory... It was a short walk to Garden Walk, just down the road along Katella Street, towards  Disney Land. At Garden Walk there is a free bus direct to Disney Land and all that comes with that. Buses leave regularly and also returns from to bus parking bays outside of Disney land.  The accommodation was convenient and handy. Room clean and has a microwave - no plates or dishes to cook in, but okay to heat or re heat food. There is a 7 Eleven within easy walk.  A Vons
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for staying with us. I am glad you had a good time.  We hope to serve your future lodging needs.

Summary: This was a family trip to Disneyland. The room was a nice size and clean. The hotel clerks were very friendly and helpful. We needed extra towels since my husband and my kids went to the hot tub and they gave them extras without any problem. The breakfast was decent but after the 3rd morning of the exact same food, it got a little monotonous. The eggs were perfect, not runny, not hard. Yummy waffles! Anyway, it was a great trip. And we booked it on Booking.com and got an amazing deal.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for staying with us.  I am glad that you liked it and enjoyed the room, the breakfast and pool.  We hope that means we will be seeing you during your next vacation.

Summary Heading: Great hotel in a great location
Summary: My wife and I had a one night stay at this hotel on December 7th in order to see a concert at the Honda Center.  Everything exceeded our expectations.  The staff was very friendly, the room was not terribly large but was very clean and well equipped, it was reasonably quiet even though we were on the freeway side, parking was free, and the continental breakfast was good.  Unlike many hotels, the room did not have an odor.  The bed was very comfortable with linens that appeared very new.  The location is really good.  It is very convenient to I-5, with quick access to the Honda Center down Katella to the east and down Katella to Disneyland on the west.  The neighborhood this hotel is in is great.  There are a large number of good, reasonably priced restaurants within walking
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  I am thrilled to hear that the property and staff did an excellent job.  I love to hear that guest's will come back.  We hope that you can come back soon.

Summary: I took my family to disneyland they had a great time staying at confort inn hotel this is our 2nd time staying here I recommend it if come with your family cuz is 10min. Away from disneyland nice place.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  I am glad to hear that you like it and you keep on coming back.  We hope that you can continue to do that for years to come.

Summary: Excellent hotel for people traveling on a budget! Located about 20 minutes walking distance (or a $6 Uber ride) away from Disneyland.  I was traveling from the San Francisco Bay Area, and I found myself in Anaheim around 10am. I called the hotel and they were so gracious as to give me an early check-in without any additional fees.   Upon arrival I was greeted by Adriana at the front desk. The other older woman at the front desk was rather rude and seemed more interested in sitting the back office than answering any questions or helping the front desk. I noticed this was a complaint other guests have already expressed. Hopefully management will take heed on these complaints and train their front desk agents properly. Even with checking in two guests, Adriana was very courteous
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for your comments.  We will use this information to help to ensure that when we help guests they all get the same friendly greeting.  We hope that you can come back and stay again.

Summary Heading: These people need to get it together !
Summary: Worst place ever ! We got a $250 smoking fee , when my husband didn't smoke in the room it was out side but because he smelled  like it and we get charged ! They just accused us and had no evident! We have a 3 year old ! We woulnt smoke in our room! We don't smoke !  why would we get a non smoking room if we wanted to smoke in our room ? !  The food was horrible Taste less ! Rude costumer service! It was extremely loud with the freeway next to it ! I can find way better for the same pice !
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for your concerns but let me assure you that we don't charge people for smoking in the room unless we have proof.  We want our guests to be happy while they stay with us and that means that all guests need to follow the rules.  We have rules in place so that each and every guest has a great experience.

Summary: For me a hotel should be be all about service .. I can look over a lot of things but service is not 1. Front desk did not care about anything .. 1st off they in the back off 99% of the time then when they finally come out they give you a additude. Not professional at all. Then I got charged for a pillow that wasn't in my room in the 1st place. Accusing me of stealing it.. What do I look like stealing a pillow. I will never stay here again and I will make sure to tell anyone and everyone I know bout Thai horrible stay unless this is fixed!!
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  I understand that our pillows are very comfortable.  Each room has the same amount of pillows.  You were charged because you liked the pillow and since it was taken we don't offer them for free.  That is why you were charged.  The front desk did explain to you our policy. I thank you for bringing it to our attention and we did take care of it.

Summary: the location is great! I couldn't believe how close it was to Disneyland for the price I paid! The room was nice and a good size, lots of space! The entire hotel was very clean and the staff were friendly & helpful. The free breakfast was a great way to start our day - eggs, sausage, make your own waffles, toast etc nothing too fancy but simple & a very nice touch. There was a nice sized fridge in the room and a microwave and the bathroom is big. We chose to walk to Disneyland which took about 20 minutes, and then a $7 cab ride home! It's super close to the outlets at Orange as well (5 minute drive). Tons of restaurants in the area as well. Loved it and would definitely stay here again especially for a Disneyland vacation it is totally perfect!
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  I am glad you had a wonderful time.  We love to hear about guest's stays especially those that loved it and will be coming back.  We want guest's to feel at home while they are on vacation.  I am happy to hear that you were satisifed and we hope to see you back soon.

Summary Heading: One of the best for you $$!!
Summary: Our stay at the comfort Inn Anaheim was fantastic! the Hotel i very well maintained and clean. We had a king suite on the highway side and we never had any problem with it. I5 is about 75 yards away with a road between the highway and the hotel. The bed was very comfortable and we had a microwave, fridge and a nice flat screen t.v. . make sure you turn the switch on below the desk for the fridge because they shut it off to save power when not occupied. The pool area was fantastic! Very large pool and hot tub with more then enough seating and lounging area. We really enjoyed the pool area. Parking was no problem and we could always find a spot. For us walking to Disneyland was too far. I would say it is around a 1/2 to 3/4 of a mile away but I may be wrong. After our stay, this
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking time out to comment about your recent stay with us. I am happy to hear that your experience was fantastic.  We hope you can come back soon.

Summary Heading: Great time at the Comfort Inn and Suites
Summary: Let me just say that this is great property made all the better by the wonderful staff and the beautiful rooms. This hotel has it all, updated well appointed rooms and very nice continental buffet in a beautiful lobby.  They helped us out with discount tickets to Knotts Berry farm and Disneyland.  They were gracious enough to play Sunday night football in the lobby while we ate take out from PF Changs.  What a cool night.  The location is not bad but be advised you can only enter the property on Katella so don't let your GPS tell you to use Manchester. We loved our 3 nights here and the next time we get to visit Disneyland  we will absolutely be back to the Comfort Inn and Suites. Thank you to the fabulous staff, you guys were the best.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for staying with us. Sorry about the location but our only entrance is off Katella.  I hope your team won.  We look forward to serving your future lodging needs.

Summary: Stayed here 3 nights for a family vacation to Disneyland & California Adventure. It was the perfect amount of time. Every day we woke up and went downstairs for free breakfast in the hotel. It was surprisingly very good! You can make belgium waffles choice of cinnamon or regular. They also have eggs, sausage, toast, pasturies, cereals, juices, coffee, milk. After digesting we went swimming. Pool & spa was clean, plenty if seating, shade, towels to dry off. they had vending machines on the bottom floor and ice machines on every floor. Its located right off the freeway which made it easy to find, also you can drive to Newport & Huntington beach. my son and I went to Balboa Island on Saturday night. what a nice place to walk around the marina! You can ride the ART shuttle to and
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for staying with us. I am happy to hear you enjoyed the breakfast, room and the pool. I am glad the location fit your needs as well.  We look forward to serving your future lodging needs.

Summary: This hotel is in a great place--next door to a market and a laundrymat if you need it.  It is a 20 minute walk from Disneyland, but two blocks from a direct shuttle (leave the hotel parking lot, walk one block to the left and cross Katella Avenue then another to get to the Peacock).  The kiosk outside sells the tickets to the Disney shuttle ($5 for adults for the day)--it's route #7.  Breakfast in the lobby is a simple continental breakfast.  Perishables (butter, cream) are kept in a small refrigerator on the counter (first time I've ever seen this in a hotel).  Free Wi-Fi available.
Manager Response: Dear Guest ,  Thank you for staying with us. I appreciate the comments you have made regarding your stay.  I hope that you get a chance to come back and stay with us again.

Summary: We stayed here 2 nights and were very pleased with our room and the hotel in general.  With so many places to choose from, we picked a nice hotel for the rate.  Although the room was on the small side it was fine since we weren't in it very much other than sleeping. Although we didn't have any kids with us, the hotel seemed very kid-friendly. There were lots of kids with their parents so if you have children this is an ideal place especially with the breakfast offered, saves you some money right off the bat.  Didn't use the pool but it looked to be clean and well kept.  Close to Disney but as far as walking goes you probably should check to see if there's a shuttle from hotel or nearby and save the walking for inside Disneyland, except of course if you have teenagers,,the
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for staying with us.  I am glad that you liked the location and the property. We hope that you can come back soon and enjoy it even longer.

Summary: We stayed at this hotel for our visit to Disney twice. Great location, only 5 mins away from Disney. Very friendly staff with clean and comfortable rooms. Free hot breakfast with incredible service. Even with only one attendant for breakfast there was never a shortage of food or utensils. She did a great job keeping everything clean too. We stayed for 3 days and each day delivered the same great service. This will definitely be the hotel we stay at for all our Disney trips to come!
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for staying with us. I am glad that the breakfast was good and the staff was helpful. We appreciate guest's feed back which helps us do our jobs better.  Thank you once again and we hope you get a chance to come back soon.

Summary: Very helpful and friendly staff, the room had everything for any length of stay, Fridge, microwave, cable tv, iron and ironing board, also very comfortable beds. The Hotel has a very spacious pool and hot-tub, its a little out of the way for disney, but right next to a freeway, so that makes getting about easier.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for staying with us. I am glad your experience was good and we look forward to seeing you back soon.

Summary: we stayed here just to get over our jet lag, we weren't sure how long we were staying, as we extended our stay there was no problem and we stayed in the same room. There is no guest laundry but there is one next door, plenty of parking, free breakfast was average. The only down side is that the A/C in the room was very noisy, but all hotels in this area have them so can't escape that, it was also close to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking time to go on line and comment about your recent stay with us. Thanks for letting us know about your issue so that we make take care of it. I am glad that you had a pleasant stay and we hope to see you soon.

Summary: This hotel was perfect for us. A short walk to the Garden Walk restaurant/shopping center. A little longer walk to Disney and the Convention Center area. A short cab ride from the Angels Stadium. The hotel was excellent for the price. The rooms were updated and clean with comfortable beds. The A/C and refrigerator worked great. The continental breakfast was decent. If you don't mind a little walk to Disney this is a great hotel. We really enjoyed it. I thought they were going to charge us for parking but since Sept is possibly a slower time, they did not charge. I would stay here again of I came back to this area. Good value.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for staying with us. I want to let you know that our parking has always been free and as for now will continue to be free.  We want people to have a good time and not worry about things. We try to make it easy for each and every guest. Thanks again and we hope to see you next time you vacation in the area.

Summary: We stayed at The Comfort Inn & Suites Anaheim for 2 nights to visit Disneyland and Disney California Adventure. Upon check-in, the staff were able to sell us tickets cheaper than the gate price which was a substantial saving. Talk about starting our stay on the right foot!  We discovered the shuttle that was previously behind the hotel was no longer running, but figured we should walk to Disney. The walk was fine, after the drive from San Diego it was good to stretch our legs and get some sun. Fast forward a day in the parks, waiting in lines and standing to watch World of Colour, then walking back to the hotel. Ouch!  Breakfast was a buffet style and more than reasonable. We discovered Americans love their bananas!  Room was a little on the dated side, but really clean. Parking
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for staying with us. The shuttle no longer picks up by us however there a few stops near by.  Also we recommend a taxi , it is fastier and sometimes cheaper. We hope that you get a chance to come back and stay with us soon.

Summary Heading: Excellent value, clean, has everything you need.
Summary: Stayed here for 3 nights, very comfortable, very clean and an excellent price. Had all you would expect in the room, coffee machine, tv etc. but also a fridge and a microwave. It has air con but it is in the room and although affective it is also very noisy so if you are a light sleeper take ear plugs or be prepared to switch it off overnight. This hotel is within walking distance of Disneyland and the Californian Adventure (20 minutes) and has free parking. They even sell some park tickets at reception. You can see the disney fireworks from some of the rooms. They have a lovely, but not very well advertised outdoor heated pool and whirl pool at the rear. There of lots of restaurants in walking distance. Breakfast is buffet style, eggs, sausage, waffles, fruit, cereal, pastries,
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for staying with us. We will check into the a/c problem. I am glad to hear that everything else was great.  We look forward to seeing you next time and we will have the issue fixed.

Summary: Hotel was great and everything we needed/wanted for a 2-day stop at Disneyland. Very clean, comfortable room included microwave and mini fridge, plus lots of counter space in the bathroom. Free internet and parking always a plus. Free breakfast each morning was perfect before starting a busy day in the park -  always grabbing an extra piece of fruit or two to snack on later saved us money, too! About 1.5 miles walk to the parks - walk is easy, under shaded palms most of the way and on completely paved sidewalks. Well lit and lots of other people walking all day so we felt safe. Our feet were tired after day 2 of nonstop walking, but we saved so much money, and honestly the walk was not bad. Plus, it's a great way to burn off those Mickey ice cream bars! Also, right by the
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you for taking time to go online and comment about your recent stay with us. I can see by your comments that you were tired but had lots of fun. I hope that the next time to come to the area you get to stay longer then 2 days. We have so much to offer in the area.

Summary: It was the first time that we stayes at a comfort inn. I happy I did, The staff was very courteous, helpful and professional. Room was nice size, beds were very comfortable. Great selection of tv channels. close to disneyland / disneywalk. close to a lot of middle eastern (halal) food which was Important for us. Overall I really liked the hotel, and will definetaly stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you for staying with us. I am thrilled that you had a wonderful stay and the staff was helpful and you found the type of food you liked.  We try to make each and every guest feel at home. We look forward to you coming and staying again with us.

Summary: Booked online from Australia all smooth with great email communications.  We arrived in LAX on a 6am flight from Australia caught our shuttle straight to the hotel hoping for an early check in and thankfully the lady on the front desk, Jennifer, was accommodating,  friendly and super helpful and was able to check us in. Hotel out dated but we were there for disneyland and used the hotel for somewhere to sleep and shower and it did its job.   Its a 10min walk from Disneyland however we used that walk to try out the bars and restaurants along the way. Bubba Gump shrimp co was great food and service and we got a free bread at California pizza kitchen for being first time diners. The comfort in hotel staff were also very accommodating as we left our bags stored while at Disneyland
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank for staying with us during your first trip to the area. I am glad that you liked it and that it was a great trip. We look forward to you coming again and staying with us.

Summary: I take an annual Disneyland trip with a friend of mine and for the last two years we have stayed here. The hotel location is great, free parking and free breakfast. The breakfast items are limited, but it's still nice to have something to eat before heading out for the day. The beds are comfortable, the room is quiet especially for how full the parking lot is (assuming the hotel is pretty full), the people are super nice that we've encountered staying here and the hotel staff all seem very nice and helpful! They have updated the breakfast area since we were here last year and it looks so much nicer! The rooms are clean and have a pretty good amount of space. Will stay here again any time I'm in the area!
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you for taking time out to comment on line about your most recent stay. I am happy to hear the staff was friendly and you liked the new update in the lobby. We hope to see you next summer.

Summary: Good  hotel quite near  Disney but not near downtown LA where we would have liked to be. Rooms are of a good size , clean, Comfortable beds and have everything you need . The rooms near the freeway side are very noisy and if you request a move you will be informed you must pay 10 dollars per night extra. The air con is extremely noisy. Breakfast is good can get very busy it is self service paper plates and plastic cutlery. Some of the staff are more helpful than others but all are  friendly The area felt safe to walk in and there are several places to eat near by. We enjoyed The Cheesecake Factory and Bubba Gump. The pool area is very nice .  We took The Grand Tour of Los Angeles  recommended by the hotel with VIP tours it most definitely  was not VIP so if you want to see LA
Manager Response: Dear Guest,   Thank you for staying with us. I am glad that you found the staff to be friendly and helpful. That the over all property was nice. However, I noticed you didn't care to much for the tour. I am sorry about that. That is the company we use and the prices are what they give us.  I do hope that during your next vacation you get a chance to talk more to the staff as they can really help out.

Summary: This hotel was better than I expected, the rates where great especially for Labor Day weekend!  Disneyland was not to far away, would stay again.  Liked that they had breakfast incl.  Pool was nice and Staff was nice and friendly.
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you for staying with us. We hope that during your next vacation you get a chance to come back earlier and stay longer.

Summary: We enjoyed our stay.  The staff was extremely friendly and helpful.  We walked to DL, which isn't a horrible hike.  The staff helped us out when we accidently left a sock in the laundry room.  They also got me some fruit when my son was needing something healthy.  We really liked the people at this hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for staying with us and I am glad to hear the front desk was able to get back your sock. We hope you can come back next summer and stay with us again.

Summary: This hotel was very good. We drove in from AZ and were able to check in early.  Room was spacious, fridge held all our food.  Continental breakfast was awesome!  Breakfast sandwiches, waffles, pastries, and cereal - plenty to fill up on to start the day.  Only disappointment was the walk to Disney - about 28 minutes ... cab fare back from disney was $10 including tip, so not too bad
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for staying with us. So glad you loved the breakfast. Since you don't live to far away I Hope that you can come back and visit us again soon.

Summary: We stayed here 3.5 years ago and I remember being satisfied and that there was a shuttle to Disneylamd which was convenient.  Once again, I'm very happy with the stay (except they no longer have the shuttle, but it's only about a $10 cab ride to DL.)  The room was very spacious, the beds were quite large (though I do remember them being higher last time but I could be wrong) and the bathroom was fantastic with counter space - though I was weirded out that the coffee machine was in the bathroom).  Mercedes at the front desk just stole my heart. She's an absolute sweetheart and went above and beyond during our stay to be helpful. The rest of the staff were also great.  The breakfast was a good variety, but I didn't particularly care for the plastic plates and cutlery.  Would stay
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking time out to go online and comment about your recent stay with us.  I am so glad to hear that our stay was outstanding and we will let her know.  Unfortunetly we no longer have the shuttle but as you pointed out there is a tax and it doesn't cost that much.  We look forward to you coming back again in the near future.

Summary Heading: Secret tip to get to Disneyland
Summary: This hotel does not have a free shuttle to Disneyland. The only suggestion the staff could give me was to walk to the Holiday Inn and pay $3 a person each way to use theirs. Google says it's a 1.2 mile walk, taking about 24 minutes. I then discovered that Disney has a satellite parking lot called their Toy Story lot (Buzz, Woody, and Jessie) 2 blocks to the west on Katella. From there, take their free shuttle directly to the gates.  Note that the bus stop is on the opposite side, so you have to go through security if you are going to or from Downtown Disney. The only other thing I didn't like was that even though it's only 2 blocks, those blocks are really really long. There are also homeless people in the area, but it's not much different from the rest of LA.   As already
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking time out and going on line to comment about your recent stay with us.  Disney is only about a 20 mins walk and yes there is another parking but Disney does charge the same 17 to park all day.  We can also arrange taxi's.  I am sorry about not offering the shuttle but there is one located near by.  I can see from your review that you did like the staff and the property.  We do hope that you can come back soon.

Summary: The hotel was so clean, the breakfast had both hot and cold options.  The front desk staff when we checked in was superb.  Fast, friendly and efficient.    The room was quite large and the shower head in the bathroom was wonderful; not the usual wimpy flow you get from some other hotel showers.     The bed was comfortable and our room was quite.  We were on the opposite side of the freeway and could see the disney fireworks from our room on the 4th floor.  The air conditioner was loud, and ran all night, but I find that most room air conditioning units are that way.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you so much for taking time out to go online and comment about your recent stay with us. I am glad the front desk was very helpful, the rooms was great and even the breakfast.  We look forward to serving your future lodging needs.

Summary: May not look like it from the outside, but this place compared to all the others is the best bang for your buck. Rooms on the freeway side can be noisy from traffic. A.C. are old in the window type. The price is right and clean is the name of my game. Great beds and clean from top to bottom . could find no fault. Lots of T.V. channels. upper floors on the parking lot side get to see the Disney fireworks show.  Spotless bath, coffee and anything you forget they got. wonderful service and rooms are pretty sound proof except motorcycles on the on ramp of the freeway, Clean carpets, beds. nice towels. We left a filthy beautiful grounds resort because it was dirty and they don't care. Enjoy this little Gem. it is centrally located with easy on and off.everything you need is near by.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking time to go on line and comment about your recent stay with us. I am glad to hear that it was better than you thought. Room was great, breakfast was great and the location was great. We hope that you get a chance to come back soon and stay again.

Summary: We stayed here this weekend for our friends birthday that was in the area. They all booked a room here and after reading some of the reviews I was hesitant, but since everyone was staying here we just went ahead and followed the crowd. We are from Riverside, and honestly I wish we would have just gone home afterwards.  The only good things I say would be that the shower worked nice and it's a good location. Unfortunately, the bed was uncomfortable and the sheets did not smell good, my back hurt badly when we woke up. Breakfast ended at 9am, if checkout is at 11am, they should extend it until then. Then what really traumatized me and my husband is that he got bed bug bites all over the bottom of his legs. Very disappointed, if we are paying $130 I would expect no bed bugs. Very
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  I am sorry you found our property not to be a fit for you.  As you can read from most of our reviews guests love the pillows, beds and bedding.  Our house keepers are very professional and keep the rooms and property very clean.  We have people even ask to buy the pillows and mattresses.  As for the bed bugs we have a very clean and well maintaned propery that we have never had an issue.  We check and re check each and every room to make sure they meet the standards of the brand as well as ours.

Summary Heading: Cheap good hotel, worked great for Disney
Summary: This was right off the highway.  I noticed some complaints about that before I booked.  When I got to the room, our window looked right out onto the highway.  That being said, I did not find it so loud as others and didn't really even notice it.  Granted, the air conditioner was pretty loud and might  have drowned out some traffic noises, but it was not so loud that we could not sleep.  Large clean bathroom with a shower that was pretty good for a hotel.  The hotel is not fancy, but it is nice and clean and was worth the price. It was about a mile from the park and it was a pretty long walk.  My husband and I did it, but it took about 25 minutes.  My mother decided it was too much for her so she paid to park at Disney.   Parking was free at the hotel!   I would stay here again
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for your comments. I am glad that you found our hotel to be comfortable.  We are off from Disney but there are taxi's which are very reasonably priced.  I hope that you can come stay with us in the future and take advantage of the service.

Summary Heading: Good location, close walking distance to Disney and Angels Stadium...
Summary: We stayed in Anaheim for the Red Sox/Angels game, and wanted to stay somewhere close to the stadium. This hotel was about a mile and a half from the stadium, a couple miles from Disney, and about 2 blocks from the Garden, which is where you can find some nice restaurant options for dinner. The hotel's amenities were decent for the cost. Continental breakfast, small workout room, swimming pool. We had vending machines close to us, which was nice for late night snacks. Parking was limited, so be prepared during busy seasons. Rooms were clean, offering refrigerator and microwave. Good sized shower/tub, and small closet. For the cost, a definitely nice stay.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for staying with us and taking time out to comment about your stay with us.  We really appreciate when guess take time out to tell us how we are doing.  We look forward to serving your future lodging needs.

Summary: We stayed here for 2 nights when visiting Disneyland and it was perfect as a base when you will be at the parks all day and need a reasonably priced clean safe option in the vicinity. The room was functional/basic but clean and perfectly adequate. The air con was great as it was really warm outside. Staff were great as they moved us from the side of the hotel facing the motorway to the quieter other side. Try and get a room on this quieter side.The pool is nice and the breakfast basic but convenient and it is a short walk around the corner to get the Disney shuttle. Would thoroughly recommend as a good base for Disneyland.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  I am glad that it was a pleasant stay and that we were able to move you and that the room was great.  We hope hope you get to travel next year and come back.

Summary: We stayed at the Comfort Inn last September for four nights.  This was our third time staying here for our yearly Disney trip.  We actually really enjoy this hotel and find it perfect for our yearly Didney trip.  If you combine the ART bus pass with this hotel it works out great.  Why: Decent included breakfast, comfy beds and room, low cost hotel, away from crowds and kids, ART bus stop is right out the front door and very easy to use (drops you right inside Disney front enterance), nice spa to wind down after full day in the park.  This hotel has always been quiet and never had one single issue.  We highly recommend the Comfort Inn and Suites at this location!
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for your comments and I am so glad you keep coming back.  I hope that you get a chance to come back soon.

Summary: We were in Anaheim for a volleyball tournament and needed an affordable place for the boys and ourselves. The Comfort Inn is conveniently located(not in middle of Disney traffic)and easy in and out to Katella. The staff is welcoming friendly and helpful. The lobby is updated and the breakfast area has been expanded since our last visit. It is much better as the breakfast area was not large enough to accommodate all of the guests for breakfast. The rooms are large enough and furnishings updated. The only complaint I had was the air conditioner. It would shut off and then come right back on. It probably needs to be serviced. Overall, it was a nice place to stay while in Anaheim.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  I am glad you had a wonderful time and I hope your team won. Hopefully you can come back next year.

Summary: We checked in mid afternoon. Reception was quiet and check-in was fast and friendly. The receptionist apologised that the two rooms we had booked were not adjoining. This was fine anyway as we had not requested this and they were in fact very close. Both rooms were clean and tidy and 1 king and one two-bedded as booked.  The rooms we had were on the noisier side of the hotel and yes, you could hear traffic noise. But we were TIRED so we still slept well. Air-con unit was on the noisy side so we switched off just before bed.  The walk to Disney was under 20 minutes but I guess we walk quite quickly. We took a taxi home on a couple of occasions at just over $7 dollars for 4 adults. If you do decide to walk back at night Gardenwalk is approx 2/3 of the way and has shops and several
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for staying with us and I am glad you liked it I hope you get a chance to come back next year.

Summary: the hotel is located very close to Disneyland park of adventure in L.A. it is a 45 minutes drive from city center [ in a very good day ] . the rooms are very big with two king size beds. very clean. a  very good service. the stuff is very friendly. there is a small swimming pool and a jacuzi outside. a very god breakfast is served. Had a very good time. I will surely comeback. a great value for the price i paid.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  I am happy to hear that you had an enjoyable stay and would come back. I hope that you get a chance to come back next year and have more fun.

Summary: It is walkable to Disneyland at about 25 mins but it is getting into the fringe ambience part of the main tourist area; so expect to share the footpath and bus shelters with down and outs. Our freeway side room was noisy even with the window shut. It is $10 per night extra to ask for a non freeway side room if they have some room availability options.The in wall air cond was also noisy. There is no fresh air into the room unless you have the window open. It sensibly has a sliding security lock so that it can open only a few cms. The room was clean and probably recently renovated and adequate but no in room safe. I used the main reception safety deposit box for passports and credit cards and it appears from how the staff manage this; that this is a rare request. I asked if they
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for staying with us. We just remodeled the entire breakfast area to ensure that it had enough room to get the food and sit down.  As from reviews it works.  If one doesn't want to walk then there is a taxi that comes right away and drops you off near the front entrance.  We are near the freeway but most people don't mind it and it is very safe as we are completley inclosed and after 1am there is only one way in.

Summary: It was a very good experience. We went for a trip to Disneyland. The location of the hotel is perfect for disneyland tour. Staffs are very friendly. Special thanks to Mercedes for assisting me in LA grand tour. I will surely comeback.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank  you for staying and noticing how helpful the staff can be. We hope that you can come back soon and stay again.

Summary: Wall had some odd damage bulge from water damamge perhaps?  Bathroom was updated, but the drapes were dated looking.  Pack and Play did not have fitted sheets, so they gave us a regular sheet to wrap around...not ideal safety.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,   Thank you for staying with us and thank you for bringing that issue to our attention.  We will look into it.  As for the crib we will take care of that too.  But I am glad that you did like your stay.  We look forward to seeing you in the near future.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel-Newly updated lobby and breakfast area
Summary: My husband, two kids and I have been staying at this hotel for 4 years for our Disneyland trips. It's clean, updated and always a quick check in and check out. It's not walking distance from Disneyland but we don't mind driving over to the park. It was nice to see the lobby and breakfast area was updated on our visit last week. We never have a problem with noise and we seem to always get the freeway side of the hotel. I'm a big person on clean hotels. It;s so nice to see they clean the bathrooms, and take care of the customers. Can't beat the free breakfast and parking :-) Will be staying again for our October trip to Disneyland. The only downside is that they really do need to get more luggage carts. We can never seem to get one while we are there and being a family of 4, with
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for staying with us.  I am sorry about the carts we will work on that.  I am glad to hear you liked the lobby and that it worked for you.  I hope that you and your family can come back soon.

Summary: We chose this hotel for a couple of reasons. It is centrally located to a lot of great attractions. We didn't do Disneyland, but it is very close. it has free breakfast and.It has interior rooms (you access your room from the inside, which makes me feel much safer. The hotel itself was nice, the rooms were clean, ours also had a fridge and microwave which is nice because we stayed there a week. I found the best rate through the hotels website. it also has free parking, a lot of them don't. There is a Del taco right across the street, which is very convenient, and a gas station less than 1/2 a block away. the hotel has rooms set up on a side that faces the I-5, and one that doesn't, but you can pay a little more to stay on the side that doesn't face the freeway. That is what we
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you so much for staying with us.  I am so glad that we offered everything you needed. Also thank you for the comment about the front desk.  They like to hear when they are doing a great job.  I hope that you will get a chance to come back soon.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel for Disneyland and Your Budget
Summary: We stayed at this hotel on the recommendation of other Trip Advisor reviews, and so glad we did!  Large room, very clean and comfortable, nice pool, lots of free parking.  Check in was very easy, staff very friendly and accommodating.  Our room was very spacious (king bed) with a microwave, refrigerator, flat screen TV, ample plug-ins in all the right places; comfortable bed and bedding; air conditioner was not noisy and worked great; free Wi-Fi worked fantastic; nice, fairly large bathroom, one sink shower-tub combo, great water pressure, hair dryer, vanity mirror attached to wall, good amount of countertop space.  Our room was on the 2nd floor at the end of the hall by the parking lot and street; great location and very quiet--didn't hear noise from any of our neighbors or
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  I am so glad that you liked the property and that you would come again. We try our best to ensure each and every guest leaves here happy and wanting to come back. I am so glad you felt that way. We hope you get a chance to come back soon.

Summary: If you are looking for a budget hotel where you don't wish to spend a lot of money (and time of course when visiting Disney) this is a reasonable hotel. Perfect fit people on a budget and not looking for anything fancy. Rooms are average, breakfast in limited in selection but it is is written the $130 pet night we paid for two queen beds.  There is no shuttle to the parks so you end up driving (5 mins) and spending $17 fire parking. The hotel should consider offering a shuttle to the park.  WiFi was free and worked well.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for staying with us. We hope that on your next visit to Disney you stay with us again.

Summary: We stayed here for 4 nights with two little ones to go to Disneyland and visit California. This hotel was great and CLEAN!! Check in was a breeze! We ate breakfast from their free buffet everyday and parking was free. It was close to parks but we had two little ones so decided to drive to disney instead. The area is really nice so walking wouldn't have been an issue if kids were older. It's right off the highway but we stayed on city side. Definetly a great hotel for visiting disney! Would def stay again!
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for staying with us. I am glad that you liked the hotel and we hope that you can come back soon.

Summary: This was a trip we were trying to be frugal on and decided to try out the Comfort Inn - def not like the bigger chain hotels near by but it was decent.  They had a nice front desk staff and a cute, small breakfast buffet in the am.  Parking free and super close to Disney and major chain restaurants.  Its is DIRECTLY near the exit for the freeway so easy to miss.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for staying with us. I am glad you liked the location and the hotel itself.  We hope you can come back soon.

Summary: This hotel saved our vacation, my girlfriend and I had booked a hotel in manhattan beach called The Wave, it was the filthiest most disgusting room I have ever stayed in.We arrived approx 9pm  so had to get stuck for the night but checked out 1st thing and drove to Anaheim, we were only there for 4 nights and had now already wasted one. We arrived at the Comfort Inn early morning, when I relayed our horror story to the front desk staff, the 2 ladies( 1believe a mgr) were wonderful, let us check in right then,what a wonderful surprise,  upgraded us to the quite side ( we had no children and no plans to go to Disneyland) the pool was clean,perfect temperature and landscape was very nice.We basically had it to ourself most of the day, rooms were clean, large with fridge, mircowave,
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  I am so glad that you came to us and that we made the rest of your vacation worth it.  I hope that this was one of the best birthdays ever.  We hope that you get to come back again next year and even the year after that.  Thank you so much for staying with us and going on line to comment about your stay.

Summary Heading: Affordable option when traveling to Disneyland
Summary: We stayed at this hotel on our trip to Disneyland.  The breakfast had many options and was one of the main reasons that we stayed at this hotel.  Many of the hotels right across from the park don't serve a good breakfast.  This one satisfied our family.  The maids cleaned the room very nicely.  The pool was nice even though we only used it one time.  The staff was very friendly and were very knowledgeable about the area and the hotel.  The only drawback is that this hotel is one mile away from the main gate of Disneyland but we knew that going in.  This hotel is a great affordable option when traveling to Anaheim.  I would stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  I am glad you liked the breakfast and that your room was clean when you returned.  We work hard to make sure each person leaves happy. We hope to see you again on your next vacation.

Summary Heading: Great deal for a great hotel
Summary: We stayed here in Feb 2014 and were pleasantly surprised.  The hotel was clean, the staff was friendly and price was great.  The breakfast was good and there were quite a few options.  The pool was really warm which felt good after a day at Disneyland.  It is a little ways from Disneyland so you have to either rent a car or take the bus. We rented a car but took the bus to the park.  Parking at Disneyland is expensive and it's offsite so you have to take a bus anyway.  So my advice to is just take the bus.  There is plenty of parking at the hotel and it's free!!!  This is where we will be staying from now on!!
