Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for staying with us. I am glad that you had an enjoyable stay and will plan on using us for your future stays in Anaheim.  We hope that you can come back soon.

Summary: This is a return trip for us to this hotel, we stay here every time we are in Anaheim. Rooms are spacioaus and clean.  Breakfast was great: sausage, eggs, cinnamon and regular waffles, yogurt, hard boiled eggs, bread, pastries, and good coffee (they did a good job keeping it full). Personnel were friendly and efficient.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for staying with us. I am glad you liked the breakfast. We look forward to serving your future lodging needs.

Summary: Took my family to Disney, stayed here, It was very close to the Disney parking lot (walking Distance) so we walked to the parking lot and took the free Disney shuttle.  I would defiantly stay again here
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank  you for staying with us and we hope you can come back soon.

Summary Heading: Good value, but a little to far of a walk to Disneyland for me!
Summary: Important note: my friends brand new 4x4 Platinum Ford truck had its tail gate ripped off out of rear parking area!!! Lots of hotel cameras but apparently no video was obtained of this theft.....????  Nice value, air conditioning not working well and sink clog in room but they fixed it less than 1 hour!!!!! Just wished that was fixed before I entered my room!!! After that it was fine.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  We make do our best to ensure each and every one's safety.  We have camera's every where.  I am sorry for your issue.  I do thank you for staying with us and hope you can come back.

Summary: We were greeted the minute we came into the very clean, and modern lobby.  It set a great tone for our visit.  We checked in, and the front desk staff was very friendly, and helpful.  I asked where the nearest In-N-Out Burger was, as we don't have any where we live, and as a former Californian, absolutely crave them!  One of the women working at the front desk promptly printed up directions for us.  So very nice of her to do for us.  We also asked about getting a room with a view of the fireworks from Disneyland.  They weren't sure they had any (They are highly requested, so you may want to enquire about these rooms when you make your reservation), but they had one left.  Lucky us!  It was five dollars a night extra, but we had a wonderful view each night of the firework show,
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for staying with us and I am so glad you had an amazing stay with us.  Our location is centrally located which makes it easier to get around.  I Hope that you get a chance to come back soon.

Summary: Stayed at the Comfort Inn & Suites before our next day visit to Disneyland and found the check in very pleasant with courteous staff.  The room was clean and refreshing with all amenities and comfortable beds for a good night's rest.  Check out was quick and easy and with a good continental breakfast to compliment our day of fun at Disneyland. The price of the room was very reasonable especially with the AARP rate and we would definitely stay here again on future travels
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for staying with us and we hope that you can come back soon.

Summary Heading: Still as good as the last time we stayed!
Summary: We spent 4 nights at this hotel to attend a dance competition where my daughter was competing. We stayed here last year for the same event, and were very satisfied, so we decided to stay again. Again, we were not disappointed! It was VERY close to where we needed to be, yet very reasonably priced. The room was quiet, the bed comfortable, and we had a great night's sleep. The complimentary breakfast in the morning was perfect for what we needed to get us through half the day. There was quite an assortment-- scrambled eggs, sausage, waffle maker, cereal, juice, toast, fruit, etc. If you left hungry, it was your own fault! I also used the fitness center a couple of times, and was happy that I got my workout in! The check-in and check-out was very easy and smooth, and we will
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for staying with us and I am so glad that you had a great experience.  I find the breakfast to be tasteful and fullfilling.  I am glad that you found it to be that way too.  We hope that you can come back soon.

Summary Heading: Room filled with cigarette smoke - staff unresponsive.
Summary: I booked a room for three nights in what I was told would be a non-smoking hotel.  On the second night, my room (and my floor) absolutely reeked of cigarette smoke. The front desk admitted that there was a problem and that someone was obviously smoking, but they could not figure out who it was. My room was filled with cigarette smoke and I was up all night choking on it.   I told the front desk on several occasions that I should NOT have to pay for a night's stay in a room that was filled with cigarette smoke. The manager was "never there" to speak to me, and no one ever followed up with me about this.  Had the staff politely refunded me for that one night, I would have been appreciative and complimentary. But that completely destroyed my impression of this hotel. Unless I
Manager Response: Dear Guest, I am sorry for your issue. We are a 100% non smoking hotel.  Each and every guest that checks in with us is aware of our policy.  As soon as it was brought to our attention We located the issue and explained we are a non smoking hotel and they left.  We helped you by located the issue and handling it as soon as we were able too.  I feel that we did our part as we can't help if some people don't obey the rules.

Summary: This past February, 2014, my husband and I stayed for nine nights at Comfort Inn & Suites in Anaheim. I highly recommend this hotel!! I'm very picky, ok, obsessed, when it comes to cleanliness, and this hotel passed with flying colors!! And quiet, too, no too thin-walls! The price was great, including a hot breakfast each day and a mid-size fridge and microwave in the room. A must for us! We weren't there for Disneyland, but found the location excellent for access to the coast and LA area. We travel frequently and if all hotels met the standards kept by this hotel, our wandering would be that much sweeter!!
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for staying with us.  We do our best to make sure we are fresh and clean.  I am glad that you found it to be a good value and clean. We hope that you can come back soon and stay again.

Summary Heading: Good place to stay when visiting Disneyland
Summary: The price was reasonable.  Breakfast was quite good.  Scrambled eggs, sausage patties, hard boiled eggs, cereals, breads, coffee, tea, juices.  Free parking.  The room was clean and comfortable with a fridge and microwave.  Air conditioning unit was loud, though, which disturbed our sleep.  The walk to Disneyland is about twenty minutes.   A convenience store is right next door.
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you for staying with us and I am glad that you had a good experience. We look forward to serving your future lodging needs.

Summary Heading: Good choice to be near Disneyland
Summary: Clean facility.  Be aware that one side of the hotel faces the freeway on ramp.  We were told that when you book you will be assigned to that side but for an extra $10/night you can be upgraded to the outer side.   We decided to stay on the noisy side anyway.  Although you can hear traffic noise, it was not a problem.  We did not have any trouble sleeping.  Breakfast is included with your stay.  Fairly complete.  Only thing I missed was availability of yogurt.  The ART transportation does not pick up at this hotel even though it looks like it should based on the ART website.  There is nowhere for the bus to wait so you will need to walk about a block to the Holiday Inn to get picked up in the morning.  You can ask the driver to drop you off in front of the Comfort Inn in the
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for staying with us and we hope to have you back soon.

Summary: There were 7 of us staying there for 2 nights on quick trip to Disney. I booked months ahead to get adjoining rooms for all of us. Although I was told that it was not guaranteed upon my arrival I was delighted to see that we did end up with the correct rooms.  Front desk staff was really nice and helpful.  We stayed on the 5th floor facing the freeway. I  know a lot of people said that this was loud but it didn't bother us at all. The rooms were spacious, had a microwave and refrigerator (bigger than a mini fridge), bathroom were big and TV's were great. Bed was super comfortable. The rooms have wall A/C units but it kept the room nice and cold. We were there when temperatures were over 100. The A/C unit was loud in comparison to other places I have stayed but again we were not
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you for staying with us. I am glad that you had a wonderful experience.  We hope that you can come back soon and stay with us.

Summary Heading: Very good value close to Disney
Summary: An excellent hotel that is a 10-12 minute walk to Disneyland and the Convention Centre. It is only a short drive to Angel Stadium and the Honda Centre. It is a very comfortable Comfort Inn with a decent breakfast, lots of channels on the television, good wi-fi and good shower pressure. The staff was friendly and the price is so much lower than other hotels in the area. It is not a "five star hotel" but warrants an excellent rating when you put everything together.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for staying with us.  I am glad to hear that your stay was great and that you would be back.  We look forward to seeing you soon.

Summary Heading: Fit for Purpose. (Family of 5 - 2 room Dinsey Trip)
Summary: We travelled from New Zealand,  there are 5 of us, 3 children aged 9, 10 and 12.  We had 2 rooms on the 5th floor.    The levels of services is frankly exceptional. Nothing was a problem.  Only comment is that some of the front desk staff can be rather keen to promote their own "transport operators" and upon research found that the recommended shuttles were not very well priced. But this is not a concern if you have access to google!  Free internet with good speed, and comfortable rooms. A little noisy from an old rattled air conditioning unit at times, but in context of the price of the room it is not a concern.    I'd be happy to go back, Though the included breakfast was fairly average, and the hotel does not have a restaurant or room service. Although they are happy with
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for staying with us. I am glad to had a wonderful experience.  Soon our lobby will be fully finished and I hope that you get a chance to come back and experience it.

Summary: The Comfort Inn in Anaheim may not be the newest hotel, however, what it lacks in shine it makes up for in value and functionality.  From the outside, it's apparent that this was an old Hampton Inn that was converted over to Comfort Inn. It's apparent when you walk in that no major renovations have occurred since that transition (hallways, rooms, still look like the 80's/90's Hampton Inn's, just without the comfortable bedding that Hampton Inn's have), however everything is still decent. My room was clean and up to my standards and the front desk was very pleasant and friendly. Breakfast was also good.   It's located very close to Disneyland - although, it's a little bit of a walk to the park. Unless you have a car, this may not be the ideal hotel for you if you're looking for
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for stayng with us and yes we are working on making it better for our guests.  We have done many things to improve the appearance and feeling of the hotel.  I am glad you found it comfortable. We hope that you will be back soon.

Summary: We stayed at the Comfort inn & Suites two weeks ago. We choose this hotel because it is very close to Disneyland, and in fact, it is. The rooms were OK, nothing exceptional. The hotel was under renovations on the lobby which made it a bit uncomfortable, as there were people working and the lobby was not nice. The breakfast is ok, the normal stuff, cereals, waffles, eggs, etc.  They do not offer transportation to Disneyland. They don't have a telephone on the business center, which does not make sense.   Also, take into consideration that is very far from Universal Studios and the whole Los Angeles Area. You need to decide if you are staying more days at Anaheim or in Los Angeles, and because of the traffic it is not viable to travel every day from the hotel to LAX.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Sorry about the lobby being redone but we did it to make it more cozy and roomy for the guests. We are now in the final stages and we hope that you can come back soon to see the final product.

Summary: I stayed here for two nights in early March when I visited Disneyland. Before I made the booking, I was struggling between Red Lion Hotel (rated at 8.2) and this hotel (rated 8.3). I was a bit concerned about the noise as it's right next to a highway. But I decided to try Comfort Inn on the grounds that they provide complimentary breakfast. And it has lived up to the standard.  Pros: Very friendly, helpful and professional staff. Very spacious and clean room. Very quiet too. I didn't hear any traffic noise. Very nice breakfast. Very budget friendly. Very comfortable stay overall.   Cons: No luggage rack but not a big deal at all. It's a bit far from Disneyland 20 minutes walk but not a big deal either. I walked all the way.   Therefore my tongue twister is comfort inn, comfort
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you for staying with us and taking time to comment about your stay with us.  I am glad that you were willing to give it a try and we were better than you expected.  We hope you get a chance to come back soon.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel at a Fair Price
Summary: Overall everything was okay except for the fact that wifi did NOT work.  After using 3 devices and spending 30 minutes on the phone with the internet support they could not find out what was wrong and asked that I just use the Hotel Lobby.  After that I gave up and went to sleep.  If Wifi was working I would have had a much better experience.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  I am sorry about the inter net. We were having some issues and were working very hard on fixing it.  It is up and running.  We have redone the whole system. I do hope you get a chance to come back soon.

Summary: Apr 14 -16 My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights with our 3 younger children ages 6,4 and 2 and found it to be perfect for our needs. This hotel is very CLEAN. I mean our room was immaculate which is a HUGE deal to me especially travelling with small children. The beds were very comfy, the rooms were quite spacious (meaning we didn't feel like we were on top of each other) and the pool was heated and very clean as well. Now for the minor issues. The hotel dinning area where one would eat breakfast is currently undergoing construction. Now this area is located a few steps away from the check-in /front counter area, so yes it is very noisy and hard to hear. The breakfast area is still open and functioning, however we took our food back to our room as there was not
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for your patience and understanding that we are working on making the eating area and lobby better and bigger.  It will be done soon and we hope that you can come back and see it. We look forward to seeing you soon.

Summary Heading: Not the greatest experience I've had
Summary: Stayed here for a week. I booked this hotel based on all the good reviews on trip advisor and the price at the time.  I obviously did not have a great experience like some of these people.  Bed was comfy, rooms were spacious   The eating area was all blocked off by big sheets of black garbage bag looking stuff as they are doing renovations so we pretty much had to eat right in front of the walkway and the lobby front desk.  Pool area was ok...didn't feel really safe as anyone during pool hours could walk off the street, through the parking lot and open the gate to the pool. I booked this hotel for the easy ART shuttle to Disney behind the hotel....little did I know I get there and apparently the day before they get a email saying that stop is no longer in use. The front desk
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  We are in the middle of making our front entrance bigger and better for our guests so that they can sit with comfort and have a good eating experience.  I am sorry but it was something we needed to do.  Very soon it will be done and I hope that you would come and check it out one more time.

Summary: The hotel was clean yet very very outdated. The windows were paper thin and you can hear cars slamming on their breaks due to the sharp turn right outside the window. We tried sleeping with the tv on to try to mute the sound but some how it managed to get turned off. No I did not set a timer! While checking out one of the managers asked how our stay was so I informed her if the loud noises. Instead of apologizing, all she had to say was, 'Oh! We haven't had any complaints about noise! ' really? Regardless we will never stay here again, much too ghetto for us. Not to mention the vending machines had cup-o-noodle soups in them. That should have been my first clue that this was not going to be a good stay.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Sorry for the noise but some people are sensitive.  Most people don't  mind it. I do hope you would reconsider we are in a very safe location.

Summary Heading: Great price, easy walk to Disneyland
Summary: My husband and I stayed at the Comfort Inn & Suites Anaheim for three nights.  For the two of us, it was an easy walk to Disneyland in about 15 minutes, and is nicely lit along the way.  There is also a shuttle right behind the hotel.  We only used the shuttle a few times, once in the evening back to the hotel and once to the park.  A good piece of information that we didn't know, was that when we got on the bus in the morning the driver said he only took payment for round trips.  We didn't know this and didn't have enough money. I don't know if this is only for pick-ups, or certain buses, but I was surprised to hear this. (Between waiting time and the large pick up on the way, I would have rather walked, and gotten there a few minutes earlier.) The breakfast offered was decent,
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for staying with us.  I am glad you had a pleasent stay and we hope to see you soon.

Summary Heading: STAY WAS CUT SHORT- POOR MANGEMENT
Summary: Our stay was cut short. We arrived at our motel on Thursday afternoon. We noticed that construction was being performed. The next morning at 8AM we were awoken to loud construction going on. I had called the front desk to see about a refund "IF" we were to leave. I was told yes, the remaining would be deposited back to our account. I called around to a few place and we figured we would just stay as most of the time would not be spent in the room, but at Disneyland. I had called the front desk and advised that we were going to stay and that's when I was connected to the manger/ owner that stated" Will you make up your mind? I have already refunded the money to your account." I had then told her that we never stated we were leaving for sure and it was an "IF" we were leaving
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  I am sorry that you misunderstood the manager.  She was trying to help you and trying to make your vacation enjoyable either with or with out us.  She did try her best. I am sorry you felt it was not enough.  I hope that you did have a good vacation and would reconsider.

Summary Heading: Very Clean-Best Service/Quality- Very Friendly Staff and Best Breakfast
Summary: Front staff- Farzana & Nosheen made us feel like a family and Etizabeth and Dana were very helpful with a smile all the time. Even breakfast time, ladies in th e kitchen very helpful and gentle.  HIghly Recommended- will stay there again- Taxi to Disneyland only $8 --- Stayed at The Comfort Inn & Suites Anaheim for 8 Days in March-2014 , Disneyland Trip with Kids/ Family. Made the right Choice- Very friendly front staff, very clean rooms, best prices and Best Staff  Very quick to answer all your questios & inquiries and very pleasent to deal with
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you so much and I happy thrilled the front desk staff was helpful and made you feel like family.  That means we did our job.  We hope to see you soon during your next trip.

Summary Heading: Good safe bet for family travelers
Summary: If you are visiting Disney or another attraction this is a good place to stay the night.  It was clean and we'll maintained.  Free breakfast was decent.  Parking lot was well lite.    Don't hesitate to stay here.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for staying with us and we hope to see you again soon.

Summary Heading: Hotel OK but major issue with sound isolation between rooms
Summary: My company booked this hotel for a professional trip for one week. I was commuting every day to the Convention Center of Annaheim. Globally the hotel was fine (correct value for money), with a plus for a very nice staff.  Location is not great, 25 minutes’ walk to the Convention Center in an unfriendly area. There is a bus coming back and forth but the timetable is not as convenient as you would think.  There is one major issue though: there are communicating doors between the rooms (at least mine had one), which are locked but which kills any kind of sound (or smell) isolation between rooms. My room neighbors were loud every night (TV, loud laughers, even the smell of beer came through the door). Every night, I knocked at their door, and as they did not shut up, called the
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for staying with us and I am sorry about the issue you had.  We do our best to make sure each and every guest is comfortable and happy during their stay with us.  I do hope that you will stay with us again and we will make sure that the location your in is much quieter and peaceful.

Summary Heading: Nice place to stay close to Disneyland
Summary: The hotel was clean and walking distance to Disneyland and all the other places around there.  The only problem we encountered are that the elevators are close to the side doors and the people that smoke tend to stand right outside the doors, so the entry way and the elevators smelled heavily of  cigarette smoke. The rest of the hotel was clean, our room had a leaky shower handle but it was okay to deal with. We would recommend the location and price being that its close to everything you need.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for staying with us and I am glad to see you had a nice time.  Thank you for the notice about the people we will address that.  We look forward to seeing you during your next vacation.

Summary: recently stayed at this hotel for 2 nights while visiting Disneyland Feb 25 & 26,2014. I was very pleased with the cleanliness fo this property! Very helpful staff and did i mention how clean the room was??! We were on the top floor on the Manchester Ave side and heard no traffic noise. This is also a great location to use the ART for Disneyland-the stop for route 12 is right outside the hotel on Manchester-literally only 150 yards or less from the entrance and it is the first pickup stop so you can always find a seat-also the first drop off stop from Disneyland so quick ride! I also ordered the ART passes online prior to our arrival and had them sent to the hotel and they were waiting there for us when we arrived! Breakfast was good-only thng i missed having was yogurt-that
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  I am glad that you found the property to be a wonderful place to come and stay.  We look forward to you  and your family coming back again soon.

Summary Heading: Our Disneyland home away from home
Summary: From beginning to end... When I called to confirm Karla was very nice! She reminded me to pick up our Art Shuttle tickets which I had forgot to ask her about. So it was nice that she remembered. She was also very helpful w/ letting me chose the floor and position of the room I wanted. I'm sure if the hotel is closer to full that would not have been do able, but she was non hesitant to help me in any way she could.  We arrived on a Saturday the 22nd.  Stayed 5 nights. Check in was quick. We were allowed to check in an hour early because our room was ready. All our questions were answered politely and our Art tickets were given to us w/o us even asking. ( u can go to ART website & pre purchase tickets on line & they will send ur shuttle passes over to the hotel for you to pick up
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you so much for going on line and commenting about your stay with. Not much more I can say, you said it all.  I am glad that you had a wonderful stay.  We hope that your next visit will be even better.

Summary: We stayed one evening here before heading to Disneyland.  The hotel is an average Comfort Inn, but given the price and the proximity to Disneyland, it makes it a bargain!  Our daughters were THRILLED with the warmth of the outside pool.  It was fantastic to go into a pool and not be COLD!  This is a major selling point for parents with small children, and we were so happy to be warm while in the pool with them.  Our 4 year old didn't want to get out of the pool to go to Downtown Disney.  I think she could have stayed in there for 3 hours.  The highway is just part of the hotel and part of why it costs less than other hotels.
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you for staying with and I am so glad that you liked the pool.  We look forward to seeing you on your next vacation.

Summary Heading: Great Room/15 minute walk to Disneyland
Summary: Great place to stay with a nice walk to Disneyland.  Staff was very helpful and courteous. Breakfast included eggs, sausage, cereal, fresh fruit and waffles. Our room was comfortable and clean.  Housekeeping was impeccable! We enjoyed our stay and would stay again!
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  thank you for staying with us. I am glad that everything was great. We look forward to seeing you soon.

Summary Heading: Do NOT stay here!  Horrible!  Dirty sheets!
Summary: This hotel is HORRIBLE! The hotel is backed up to the highway and the sound is SO loud during the night. It kept me up for most of the night. The next morning I found blood on the sheets that the manager Dana told me was chocolate. We didn t have food in the room so either way the sheets were NOT cleaned in-between guests. GROSS!   I wish I could stand at the door and warn guests about staying at this hotel. The next morning I had bug bites on the back of my calf. Please DO NOT STAY here! Take your kids to a better place!
Manager Response: Dear Guest, In response to your comments.   For some people noise can be an issue and we do have a quieter side.  Also , The sheets were inspected and yes it was fresh chocolate from someone in the room.  Our house keepers as you can see from the reviews keep the rooms very clean and as for the bug bites again we keep the place so clean that we don't have that issue.  When a person spends 1 night in a place you really can't tell if it is good or bad but from our reviews I say it is pretty good.  I am sorry you didn't like. Hope you find a good place to stay.

Summary: The Comfort Inn rooms were clean and the beds and pillows were comfortable.  We were on the fourth floor and had no problems with noise.  The pool was heated which was nice for the kids.  Service checking in was a little slow but we were able to check in early.  Breakfast included the following options:  sausage patties, scrambled eggs, hard boiled eggs, waffles, toast, pastries, cereal, toast, and juices.  The Comfort Inn is close to the park but you can't turn left out of the hotel (towards Disneyland).  You have to pull out and quickly get across three lanes so you can make a U-Turn at the second signal to go back to the park.  That was our only inconvenience and mainly during rush hour traffic.  Definitely worth the money.
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank for taking time to comment about your recent stay with us.  I am glad to hear that all went well. No major issues. We hope to see you next time you vacation in this area.

Summary: My wife and I recently stayed for 4 nights. We chose this hotel because of its short walk to Disneyland, as well as the fact that it included free parking (which is hard to come by around Disney) and free breakfast. We requested a king room, and we're given a king room on the 4th floor, which was great! We overlooked the parking lot, which I would recommend as we were able watch the Disney fireworks from our bedroom window in the evening. The parking lot is also on the side away from the freeway entrance, which i supposed could get loud during rush hours. We never had any noise issues, other than the AC unit was a little loud. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. I docked a point because our in room fridge didn't work. We didn't really use it for anything, but would
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for staying with us.  I am glad that you had a pleasant stay.  Room was good, staff was great and location wasn't bad.  I hope that when you do come back to this area you do come and stay again.

Summary: My husband and I are local Disneyland passholders who live about an hour away. We recently got married and decided last minute to stay in Anaheim overnight as a mini honeymoon. It was a busy weekend at the park and we were having trouble finding a room. We came across this hotel and we were lucky enough to book the last room. As soon as we got settled in, we were tempted to just stay in the room rather than going to the Park. It was so clean and comfortable. The beds were super comfy, and we slept very well that night. Breakfast had a nice variety of food. Overall, it was comfortable, clean, safe, with friendly staff, conveniently close to Disneyland, with the peace and privacy we were hoping for. I only wish we could afford to stay here more often.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for your comments. I hope that your mini honymoon was great.  If you call us directly, say a month a head of time we can help with you staying with us more often.  We hope you get a chance to come back soon.

Summary Heading: Would stay again. Good location and economical
Summary: Our family of four stayed here for 6 days. The location was convenient, if you are driving it is right off the I-5 and if you need a shuttle to get to Disneyland, it stops literally around the corner every 20 minutes. We drove and it was about 45mins from LAX. Parking at the hotel was free We stayed in a 2 Queen bedroom with a "City" view. It was a bit more a night, and provided a good view of the fireworks each night, which the kids liked on the days we didn't go to the park. The room was clean and the beds were comfortable. It had a fridge and microwave which we definitely took advantage of. Breakfast was provided each morning until 9:30am and consisted of waffles, eggs, sausage patties, juices, coffee, fruit and baked goods. After day 4 it got a bit routine, but the kids
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  I am so glad to hear that you stayed so long and had a fantastic stay with us.  I hope that you and your friends and family get a chance to come and stay with us again soon.

Summary Heading: Long ride from airport but conveniently close to Disneyland
Summary: This is a fine hotel for the budget-minded. Clean and conveniently located near the Disneyland parks. Front desk staff are very pleasant. Free breakfast and Internet.   A shuttle bus that goes to Disneyland stops just outside this property, but you must buy your shuttle passes up the road at another hotel. The walk is not far and you can buy 3-day passes to match your 3-day Park Hopper tickets.  A concenience store is just next door and a fast food taco joint just across the street.   Overall, we were pleased in spite of this being an older property.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for staying with us and taking time out to comment about your recent stay with us.  I am glad to hear that you found the stay to be pleasant. We look forward to seeing you on your next vacation.

Summary: NO room at check in. they oversold the hotel.  Chair in the room was filthy. EXTREMELY NOISY! Not your typical Comfort INN NO CUSTOMER SERVICE THIS is the price of a Marriott w the service of a Motel 6
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Our customer service is one of the best as you can read from other guests.  We went far and above to try and make you happy.  There are a few people that no matter how much we try we can't make happy.   We offered to let you check out as soon as you disliked the room with no charge and you refused.  We offered to move you to another room and again you refused. We were very polite and tried to help as much as possible.  We found you and your husband to be overly aggressive. Yet we still kept a smile and a calm voice to try and help again. Even at check out we still were friendly and tried to help once again but again you refused.  I am sorry you had such an unpleasant stay and won't come back.  But that is ok with us.

Summary Heading: Clean, economical, great for our family day trip to Disneyland
Summary: We were here for two nights - we drove in to spend a day in Disneyland with our married daughter, son in law and 2 small grandchildren.  The hotel was CLEAN, the rugs were CLEAN, the bathrooms were spotlessly CLEAN (and I am fussy about noticing things like toothpaste spatter...).  The front desk folks were beyond helpful and quick to respond to us when we had a question.    When I checked us in, there was no problem getting the rooms we asked for (adjoining rooms with a king bed in one room and 2 queens and a crib in the other).  The rooms were reasonably priced and did i mention CLEAN?  The pool was fun for a swim in the late afternoon.  The hotel was a little too far to Disneyland for us to walk, but the money we saved with the hotel was more than worth the price of parking
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  I am glad that you noticed how clean the rooms were and the main thing even I check is the bathroom.  Thank you for that and the house keeping thanks you for acknowledging it.  We come you can come back next year and stay with us again. Once again thank you for taking time out to go on line and comment about what a great stay you had with us.

Summary: We loved our stay at this hotel. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the maids did a great job each day serving our room. Breakfast was good, although a better selection of pastries would have been nice, but apart from that everything else was great. A must stay if you are visiting Disneyland.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for commenting about your stay with us.  I am glad that the staff and housekeeping did a great job.  We hope to see you next year.

Summary: My son and  I stayed at the The Comfort Inn & Suites Anaheim, Disneyland Resort for 1 night before We flew from the John Wayne Orange County airport. I found the hotel to Be excellent. Nice, clean and comfortable. The building looks a bit older but I believe the Hotel must have been renovated because the rooms aren't dated at all. The breakfast was very good. The location is excellent right beside the 5 freeway. I stay at a lot of Marriott properties. I am usually skeptical of Choice hotel properties but this hotel compares very favorable with most Courtyard by Marriott's, is better than some and is much cheaper than Courtyards. If It has a negative it's not the hotels fault but if Your traveling West on Katella Ave. You can't turn into the Hotel because the road has a barrier
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Sorry about the entrance but once you figure it out then it's easy.  Another then that I am glad to hear that your stay was enjoyable even better then the Marriott.  That's great.  I hope that next time your in town you come stay with us.

Summary Heading: Excellent Hotel, close to parks, clean and comfortable!
Summary: I stayed for 2 nights (with wife and 4 years old daughter), we arrived on Nov 30th 2013, pretty amazed for the location and the surroundings, everything looks like it's Sunday night or some festive day, really quiet!, the parking lot it's ok and you got a privilege door that goes directly to it, and you just open it with your room key. (just as can be found on every comfort inn across country) Somehow we were really pleased with this one in particular and here is why:   - The front desk staff they were so friendly and the check in was made in just like 5 minutes or so.  - We got room number 310, by the window you can see the I-5 and that's it, we were a little concerned about the noise coming from the freeway because most of reviews said so, but let me tell you something, is
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  I am glad that check in was smooth, you liked breakfast, the room and even after a long day at Disney you came back to a fresh clean room. Our staff over all works hard to make sure each guest has an enjoyable stay with us.  Thank you for staying with us and we hope to see you next year.

Summary Heading: Good free breakfast and spacious room
Summary: Stayed there on 12-20-2013 for 3 nights, it was pretty good stay, for the price I pay, i think it is above average for 2 people stay @$75 (after tax).  Location is just right NEXT to Hwy5 which can be good or bad, a bit noisy, we stayed in the 5th floor which is the highest for the hotel, i still can hear the car noise.  I think this is very very spacious room, I would say the room I stayed (1 King size bed), can put another twin/queen bed there, it is quite big for 2 people room.  I like it.  For the cleanliness, I think they are acceptable, the pillows are a bit too low for me.  The only complain about the room is the sofa-chair, a bit torn out, I see holes and such, so kinda disgusting about that.  Other than that, I think the stay was decent and comfortable.  Breakfast was
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for staying with us and commenting about your recent stay.  I am glad you enjoyed your stay and found the room to be spaious.  We did take care of the chair. Once again thank you for staying with us and he hope to see you soon.

Summary: Was very surprised by this hotel,we booked it for a two night stop over just to see Disney at Christmas,was doubtful of its location because It wasn't on the main road at Disney and having been to Anaheim before I knew that the area out with the main Disney area isn't for walking about but once we arrived at the hotel we found that the Disney bus route 12stopped right at the door and only served another hotel,this means that you are first on and first off and it isn't as busy as the other routes that serve 3or4 hotels.you can travel on the bus for 3dollars per person one way or purchase an all day pass for 5dollars per person although you can't buy the bus pass at the hotel,but you can walk to the other hotel(holiday inn)just around the corner and buy them from the machine were
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Glad that we meant with your expectations and beyond.  I hope that you will be back soon or at least on your next vacation.

Summary: It's not the closest hotel to Disneyland, but this is a really great place to stay!  The room was spotlessly clean, nicely carpeted, and nicely furnished; internet service was great, refrigerator in the room, and a nice hot breakfast in the morning.  People at the front desk were friendly and helpful.  There was ample free parking.  If you don't mind doing some hiking, it is possible to walk to Disneyland in the morning (maybe about 25 minutes).  The return is easier by taking the Disneyland shuttle to the Toy Story parking lot, then walking a much shorter distance back to the hotel.   Could not find any negatives at this hotel and would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  I am glad you liked it, the rooms, the breakfast and the staff.  We love to hear that our guests had a great time and will be back.  We hope that will be soon.

Summary: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights. We stayed in rooms away from highway, so it was. Not sure how noisy it would be if it is facing highway. Hotel is clean and neat and adequately equipped. Rooms are of decent size, bathrooms were clean. Front desk staff was very informative and helpful. Parking is free. Location is good. If you are going to Disney parks, do not drive, instead take local bus, it is cheaper and faster. Only room for improvement is with breakfast, it is very basic, no bagels :(.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  thank you for staying with us and I am glad if meant with all your needs.  We hope to see you soon.

Summary: My family and I have stayed at this hotel many times. We first tried it a few years back during one of our bi-annual trips to Disneyland. The hotel is clean, the staff is great, and even staying facing the interstate is fine. The view never mattered much and the noise never bothers us. In fact I really never notice it. The drive to Disney is short and easy. The breakfast is good, although my only complaint is with it. The juice is way to watered down. A glass of OJ is really just water with a hint of orange. We usually have our own drinks in the fridge in our room anyway. That is really my only complaint. We just booked our room for our upcoming trip in February, and actually refused a groupon for a different hotel, even though it is cheaper, because we are so comfortable with
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you for staying with us and sorry about the oj.  I am glad everything else was great. We hope to see you soon.

Summary: This is my second stay at The Comfort Inn and Suites at 300 E Katella Ave, Anaheim, CA. On both occasions my daughter and I stayed for a total of ten days. I have on both occasions been more than satisfied with every facet of my stay. Our room was always exquisitely clean and orderly. My daughter and I were in the area attending an event and it was so nice at the end of our long days ofactivity to come back to a room that had been so beautifully and lovingly cleaned. Also any care or concern that I had during my stay was always professionally and kindly addressed. During our initial check-in, my daughter and I had taken a three day train ride to get to Anaheim and the check-in staff  made sure that we were able to get in our room as soon as possible. Also on both stays we were
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  I am glad to hear you loved it and we were able to accommidate all your needs.  I hope you loved the fire works.  We hope to see you again soon.

Summary Heading: Great hotel minutes from Disneyland Resort
Summary: The Comfort Inn & Suites was a nice surprise.  The price was low, the room was very clean, and the stay included a deluxe continental breakfast with make-your-own waffles, and scrambled eggs and sausage, in addition to fruit and cereal and breads.  The front desk staff was very pleasant and accommodating.  Best of all, the location is about a mile or less from the Disneyland Resort parking lots.  If you're energetic, you could walk to the Disneyland Downtown Village and/or the parks of Disneyland and California Adventure.  This was a very pleasant stay and we would definitely return.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for staying with us and commenting about your recent stay.  I am glad you enjoyed it and that everything was to your liking.  We hope that on your next vacation you and your family come stay with us.

Summary: I first stayed here in 2004, the property is still very nice but has declined a tad.  The check-in was quick, smooth and polite. I made the reservation last minute due to a horrid other reservation and hotel up the road on Harbor (see other review). The staff was very quick and polite with no issues.  The parking gets a bit full and the entrance to the hotel is only from East-bound Katella, making it a bit difficult to get in and out of the property. The rooms are clean, quiet and nice. I had a good sleep after returning around 3am.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for staying with us. Glad to hear you still like it. We hope to see you soon.

Summary Heading: Good for overnight or a budget visit to Disneyland
Summary: We stayed at this hotel for one night using our Choice Hotel points. We had been staying on the Disneyland property, and needed a hotel for one night before flying home. We were dismayed after reading reviews of Choice properties near the airport, and were happily surprised to discover the Anaheim Comfort Inn & Suites. It lived up to the good reviews, and made the last night of our stay at Disneyland very enjoyable.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for staying and I am glad you choose us and you liked it.  We hope to see you soon.

Summary: My wife and I stayed here for our Honeymoon years ago as per the suggestion of my father.  We have to say, for the price it was fantastic.  The rooms were clean, the continental breakfast was better than most (keep in mind, it is not gourmet, but for a contintential breakfast it delivers more than expected.)  We could have walked to Disneyland, but used the shuttle instead, which was very reasonably priced.  We have stayed there a couple more times and have never been disappointed.    This is not a five-star hotel, but for the price and accomodations we have not found a better deal in Anaheim.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking time out to comment about your stay with us.  I am glad to hear that you loved it.  We look forward to seeing you again on your next stay in Anaheim.

Summary: We had read the reviews before choosing this hotel and we were not disappointed. Very nicely maintained and attractive hotel, breakfast was nice with good variety, rooms nice size and clean and well equipped , quality overall.  We would definitely return and heartily recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  I am thirlled you enjoyed your stay and would like your friends and family to stay with us as well. Thank you so much for commenting on line and we look forward to seeing you in the near future.

Summary Heading: Good place to stay near Disney
Summary: Our kids wanted to go to VidCon so I found this place near the Anaheim Convention Center. The price was reasonable, free parking, free breakfast and near the highway.  The breakfast was ok. There was plenty of tables for breakfast in the lobby. The pool looked nice but never used it. The room was comfortable and clean. The bathroom was nice. Our room faced the highway so it was a little noisy but not too bad. The convention center was about 5-6 blocks away. Sidewalks all the way. Downtown Disney was within walking distance. There are several restaurants between the convention center & the hotel too. There's a gas station & convenience store on the next block too.  Overall, it was a good location for what we wanted. Would stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  I am glad to hear that you had a enjoyable stay.  Everything meant with your needs.  We look forward to seeing you on your next vacation.

Summary: We stayed here for 5 nights. Our room had one king size bed, wich was very comfy. Room itself was quite big, nicely decorated and very quiet (Y)  Wifi connection was  ok for just cheking you e-mails, but not good enough for skype calls - so we did those on the business room.   Breakfast was average but ok, breakfastroom was small and very crowded every morning. There was always spaces on parking lot.   Located very close to Disneyland - 20 min walk, also lots of places to have nice dinner nearby. We loved BubbaGump - their  shrimp macaroni & cheese was super delicious!  Good outlet shops also very close - few minutes by car :)  We enjoyed our stay very much!
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for staying with us. I am glad to hear that you liked the bed and the size of the room. Sorry about space at breakfast that will be soon improved.  Thank you again for staying with us and we hope to see you again on your next trip.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay near Disney
Summary: We stayed here for 2 nights just to go to Disneyland.  The hotel is basic just what you would expect for the price, it was everything we needed though so it was good.  There is a Del Taco across the road and a few more shops in very close walking distance which is good.  Disney is only a 20 minute walk away which is handy.  The only thing is breakfast is pretty bad but fine for a bowl of cereal before you go to Disney.  The pool area seemed ok, we didn't go in but we used the small gym which was great.  Staff were friendly I would recommend this hotel for a cheap yet comfortable stay near Disney.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for commenting about your recent stay. Your information will help us in the future. We hope to see you on your next vacation to our area.

Summary: We stayed here for a weekend at Disneyland. Check-in and out was quick ans easy. The elevators are located on the middle of the building with aide entrance from the parking lot. Our room was a 2bed, it was clean, bathroom was clean and comes with small bath amenities. Free breakfast was average in general but with the price that we pain for our hotel room, it is good enough. We did not use pool since it was windy that weekend. There are plenty of parking in the back.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for staying with us and we hope that on your next vacation you come back.

Summary: My husband, 19 year old daughter and I recently spent 4 nights at the Comfort Inn and Suites. We had 2 x queen beds in the one room and whilst small the room was spotlessly clean and the beds very comfortable. The only downside was the very noisy air conditioning unit - fortunately we were able to open a window at night so this was not a huge problem.The daily continental breakfast was basic but plentiful and provided a good start to the day. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. Located a comfortable 15-20 minute walk to Disneyland we found this hotel more than satisfied our needs. An enjoyable stay and we would thoroughly recommend The Comfort Inn and Suites!
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for commenting about your recent stay.  Your comments are helpful in letting us know how we are doing.  Thank you again and we hope to see you soon.

Summary: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and from the moment I arrived until I left felt like the most important person in the room. On arriving I was warmly welcomed, and they ensured I knew that if I had any problems at all, to let them know. The location is not really next to anything, however, as someone who likes to walk, it was a perfect fit for me. However, there is a bus stop outside the hotel, and they also were more than happy to organise taxi's if needed, and provided a price guideline. The room was a great size, and very clean. The bed was the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in, amazingly so! I was on the 2nd floor, on the freeway side, but it was not annoyingly loud, in fact I switched it off mostly. They supplied free breakfast, and it had a great range of foods.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking time out to comment about your most recent stay with us.  I am thrilled to hear that you loved it.  The staff and the property were A class. Your feedback and information is very helpful in letting us know how we are doing. Once again thank you and we look forward to seeing you on your next vacation.

Summary: My husband and I recently stayed here for the 2nd time in the last two years and I'm just as impressed as I was the first time. I'm 7 months pregnant and this was our last trip to Disneyland before our little one is born. Comfort was extremely important to me. The beds are super comfy and they give you PLENTY of pillows. The rooms are always clean, the staff, very friendly and helpful. The breakfast is adequate, but if you really want a treat, try out the little family run donuts shop next door. It's very small and unassuming, but we ended up frequenting this place all week because I was HOOKED! By the end of the week the owner was giving me free donuts. Pregnant lady heaven! All in all, we really enjoy staying at the Comfort Inn and always recommend it to our friends.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for staying with us. Yes the donut shop next door has wonderful donuts.  I am glad you liked the room and the staff was helpful.  We look forward to seeing you on you next vacation.

Summary: This Comfort Inn is about a 2 mile walk from the main entrance to Disneyland.  The room was somewhat small, but big enough for a couple.  Comfortable bed, decent linens, clean room.  The fact that the hotel is right next to a freeway makes it a bit noisy in rooms on the east side of the hotel.  The front desk staff was very helpful throughout our stay, and always cheerful.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for staying with us and writing about your experience at your property.  Yes some people find the freeway noisy but we do offer the other side.  We hope that you will be coming back.

Summary Heading: Comfort Inn and Suites Anaheim, Disneyland Resort
Summary: Clean, Clean, Clean...  Staff was very friendly, room was perfect, bathroom was big and super clean.  Beds were comfy, TV was updated and worked perfectly.  We stayed on the 5th floor so we couldn't hear anyone walking above us and we paid the extra $10.00 to not face the freeway, and on the weekends - you can see the fireworks from Disneyland.  Breakfast was good was a good assortment of goodies. Cereal,coffee, tea, toast, muffins, donuts, fruit eggs, sausage, and two make your own waffle machines.  It's super close to Disney - you can drive or take the bus for $3.00 that you can catch around the corner. You can walk  - but it's a longish walk!!   We ate at the Cheesecake Factory that was less than five minutes away.  There is also a Roys Hawaiian Fusion, Bubba Gump, McCormick
Manager Response: Dear Guest, I am glad to hear that you had a wonderful stay.  You enjoyed the fireworks.  The breakfast was good.  Staff helpful.  I thank you for taking time to write about your stay with us and we hope that you come back soon.

Summary: Staff was very friendly, everything super clean and the rooms are updated. Great location and super close to Disneyland! Has pool and jacuzzi. Seems to be very quiet. All rooms interior corridor. Updated TV and decorations. Updated bathroom with marble counter. Will definitely stay again! Thanks, Comfort Inn!
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for choosing us. I am thrilled to hear that it was an excellant stay.  You liked it very much.  I am glad the staff was sweet and helpful.  We hope to see you soon on your next vacation.

Summary: This was a great find. Breakfast included and a laundromat in the shops next door. Great size rooms and very comfortable beds. Very clean and the staff were excellent. You can walk to Disneyland and California adventure park. Close to restaurants. Tony Roma ribs and the Cheesecake Factory a must for eating out..
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for commenting about your recent stay with us.  I am glad to hear it was wonderful and you liked the location.  We hope that you will come back soon.

Summary Heading: Excellent Best Value for the Money
Summary: Excellent stay, friendly knowledgeable staff of the local area, within walking distance to Disneyland Park  & Disney California Adventure Park and The Shops at Anaheim GardenWalk. Easy location to find, easy access to I-5.
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you for taking time to comment about your recent stay with us online. I am glad to hear you liked your stay and we hope to see you on your next vacation.

Summary: We stayed here 3 nights to enjoy Disneyland.  It was a great buy!   It was very inexpensive and we didn't expect much.  We were pleasantly surprised!  The ladies at the desk were very accommodating when we arrived and let us change our room to the side away from the road noise.  The room was very clean and the bed excellent.  The bathroom very large with a nice long countertop and underneath storage.  The breakfast was great and they kept it well supplied.  We will definitely stay here again when visiting Disneyland.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  I am thrilled to hear we were better then you expected.  I hope you will refer your friends and family to come and stay with us.  We hope to see you next year or your next vacation. Thank you so much for commenting.

Summary: This is a good hotel in a great location, 5mins drive from disneyland and the Angels baseball stadium. The hotel has a very good pool area and breakfast is included in the price. Unfortunatly the gym was a let down as only the jogging machine was working.  The room was large with a spacious bathroom, Cable tv and wireless internet.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking time to comment about your recent stay with us.  I am sorry about the machine not working.  We have taken care of it.  I am glad to hear your over all stay with us was good.  We hope to see you again next year.

Summary: We stayed one night to attend a concert nearby. The front desk staff were extremely accommodating. I asked for a quiet room and my granddaughter was on crutches (sprained ankle) and they gave us a handicapped room on the first floor without asking. When I asked for directions to the venue (only a mile away) they printed directions as well as told me. The room was very clean and nicely decorated.  The bed was extremely comfortable and the pillows (four) were wonderful.  There was plenty of seating in the breakfast area. Plenty of well lit parking area. I would certainly stay there again.
Manager Response: Dear guest,  I am so glad that you were able to comment about your stay on line.  I am even happier that the front desk was able to accommodate and help you.  We appreciate your business and we hope to see you next time your in town.

Summary Heading: Clean, comfortable and Easy access to Disneyland
Summary: We stayed here for 4 nights  whilst visiting  Disneyland and had a very enjoyable stay. The rooms were clean, comfortable and the shower had good water pressure. The air conditioner was a little noisy though. The breakfast was the usual waffles, cereal, pastries and fruits which was fine. The staff topped up all of this regularly so there was no problem of you missing out if you came down late for breakfast. The internet was good, but would slow down in the evenings. There is plenty of parking, and it is close to a restaurant strip so there are plenty of options for dinner nearby.
Manager Response: Dear Guest ,  Thank you for taking time to go on line and talk about your stay with us. I am glad to hear you enjoyed your stay, you liked the breakfast and even found the wifi to be working.  We look forward to serving your future lodging needs.

Summary Heading: Best Comfort Inn I have every stayed at
Summary: Only recently have I begun to stay at Comfort Inns.  Usually stay at Holiday Inn and Express, but they seem to be getting more expensive.  The other CI and S's I have stayed at have been good but not as good as HI chain.  That changed with this hotel.  This hotel is very up to date, clean, and accessible to all major attractions in Anaheim.  The pool was immaculate and open from 9 - 10.  My room was spotless and the bed was extremely comfortable.  Room had a large fridge and large flat screen tv.  For the price this is an excellent value.  I bought ahead of time so got the lower prepaid rate.    Breakfast was fine with lots of choices, only down side was no yogurt.  Had sausage, eggs, waffles, cereal, toast, donuts, danish, HB eggs, and fruit.  Will definitely stay at Comfort
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you so much for picking our property over any other.  I am glad to hear that we made a repeat customer out of you.  The house keepers and front desk work hard to ensure the guest is happy while here and when they leave they leave with a great big smile.  We hope that you will travel soon and we look forward to seeing you again.

Summary: Stayed here for 2 nights and got the best service, clean room, nice breakfast and very accommodating and friendly staff at the front desk ESP Ms. Adriana. I would definitely come back and recommend this hotel to my family and friends.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for noticing our clean property and friendly staff.  I am glad to hear that we made your stay a wonderful one and that you will be back again.  We look forward to that. See you soon.

Summary Heading: Good value family hotel close to most things!
Summary: We stayed here for 3 nights (2 adults, 2 kids aged 12 & 10) and really enjoyed it. Close to Disney of course, but also to shops/restaurants etc. Room clean and well presented, although air con unit was a little noisy. Great value with self serve breakfast included (although we had to wait for a table sometimes as it was busy) and plenty of onsite parking.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for staying with us.  I know that breakfast can be busy, but we will be working on that soon.  I hope that when you vacation again in the area you will come and stay with us and enjoy the breakfast again.

Summary Heading: Perfect location amazing room brilliant brekky
Summary: Value for money with an excellent setup. Great room very clean, plenty of car parking, sun drenched pool, friendly helpful staff and a huge breakfast. Huge king bed was super comfy and the a/c wa great. Ideal for you socal/disneyland stay!
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for staying with us and commenting about how wonderful your stay with us was.  On those hot days I bet the pool was refreshing.  Many people like the rooms and the beds, they are very comfortable.  Once again thank you for staying with us and we hope to see you again on your next vacation.

Summary: Stayed here 7 nights while on vacation. 4 of the nights were on Choice points. I paid $113.00 per night for the other 3 nights.   This is a nice hotel. The pool/hotub area (outdoor) was nice. The room itself was nice, not overly spacious, but no complaints. They did have a pull out circular mirror in the bathroom which I think is a must in all hotel bathrooms, but you rarely see them. The A/C worked fine, with a digital thermostat on the unit which makes temperature setting easier. I used the exercise room, and was satisfied. The complimentary breakfast looked quite good, however it was so busy EVERY morning, I honestly couldn't even use it (this was my only real complaint about my stay here). The only other possible issue was the area...at times there were some questionable
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for staying with us.  I am glad to hear that you liked the over view of the property and enjoyed your stay.  Just to let you and others know that we will be enlarging the breakfast area soon.  I hope on your next visit you will come stay with us and enjoy the breakfast.

Summary: We stayed here with friends. Each couple in a king room. The rooms were very spacious and clean. I loved having a microwave and refrigerator in the room but I really wish they would keep the refrigerator ready for use. While I appreciate saving energy (I recycle, whatever) a refrigerator takes several hours to come to temperature. We had dinner (Marri's- fantastic!) and brought home leftovers. Didn't notice until the next day that the refrigerator wasn't ready to go. Spoiled food is no fun.  Parking here is free, but limited. It was a irritating to return to the hotel after dinner to find it full.   We didn't get to have breakfast as there was a leak in the ceiling. It appeared to be a basic hotel breakfast.   I would stay here again, and I'll check the refrigerator before I put
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for staying with us and yes we conserve energy so the refridge and microwave is off. We have signs in each room explaining to guests on how to turn it on.  We are more in happy to help as well.  I am glad that you had a pleasant stay and would come back.  We look forward to seeing you again.

Summary: This was a nice enough property.  Despite it’s proximity to Disney it reminded me more of a business hotel than a vacation / resort.  Although it’s adjacent to the I-5, the great wall of So Cal eliminates the noise, or maybe we just didn’t hear it because we were on the other side of the building.   The in-room flat screen TV was huge and the Wi-FI worked great. You can walk to several restaurants at the nearby Garden Walk, about 3-4 blocks up Katella.   The pool area is nice enough and is well appointed.  The jets in the Jacuzzi did an awesome job of soothing my tired muscles from flying, driving and a day of Disney.    If you don’t want to spend a lot on accommodations for Disney and plan on spending most of your time in the parks, stay here and take the ART shuttle which
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for choosing our property for you lodging needs in anaheim.  I am glad to hear that you had a wonderful experience and would return.  We look forwarding to serving your future lodging needs.

Summary: I have stayed at the Comfort Inn now for going on close to one year. it is a wonderful alternative to renting an apartment as the motel provides a certain number of rooms for weekly rental. the staff is excellent and the maids and maintenance crew are top shelf. I have been treated fairly and professionally by all of the employees here. sometimes are some rowdy guess but very infrequently. I found my stay here to be very pleasant and my privacy respected by all the employees of the Comfort Inn. Jerry Hessen #233
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you for staying with us and going on line to comment about your recent stay. We train our staff to be polite and professional.  We want our guests to feel like they are at home when they aren't.  I am glad to hear that you like it hear and you'll be back. Once again thank you.

Summary: I'm not one to "slam" any business or hotel just because things happen.  In my business, things happen all the time, so I'm keeping this in mind while I type this.  Im in Hotels 200 nights a year.....this is a first.  I was the Murphy's Law traveler yesterday.  Delayed flight, late meetings, heavy traffic, blah blah blah.   I needed to get work done in a room.  I found this place via my agent on a spur of the moment.  Got the room, life was grand.  Front Staff, friendly and helpful.  checked out the room, pretty nice....its a hotel room.   3 baby spiders crawling on my pillows......resolved myself...stuff happens.  Fridge door wide open, halfway off the shelf and not working.  My gut was telling me.......look out.  Ordered food ( delivery )....Marri's was great.    Now the wrath
Manager Response: Dear Guest, We have updated our wifi and on occasions people will get kicked off, However that is rare and is normally fixed right away.  That night in question, A guest across from you had left the tub plugged and the water running for hours.  We of course had to clean up the mess to ensure that we don't develope any issues in the future.  That was an unfore see issue that had to be taken care of right away. We have no plumbing issues unless of course one is caused.  We are sorry for the inconvience it may have caused you but this was out of our control and we resolved it as fast as possible.   Upon check out  we ask all guests how was their stay and at that time quests comment, but we were told nothing.  We also reply with have a nice day.

Summary: After our first accommodation booking fell through (hotel closed down) Expedia transferred us to this hotel and I am SO glad they did.  The rooms were spacious, clean and air conditioned. The location was excellent - if you were up for the 25 or so minute walk to Disneyland then you could leave the car behind and not have to worry about Disneyland parking costs.   The complimentary breakfast was good, loved the waffle machines! The free wifi was reliable, and the pool area was nice to relax by after a long day of sightseeing.  Would definitely recommend this accommodation to anyone looking in the Anaheim/Disneyland area.
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you for staying with us and that you found our property to be worth the stay.   We look forward to serving you, your family and friends future lodging needs.

Summary: If you are going to Disneyland this is a great hotel. Only 10 minutes by car. Parking is $16 at Disney lot and there is a shuttle that will take you to the front entrance. Hotel has a shuttle that departs every 15 minutes. Cost is $3 one way or $6 one way (???) check with hotel. I had two rooms (my family and my son's family). I requested for two rooms next to each other and got them. We scheduled to arrive on july 11th but did not arrive until 4:00am July 12th. Our rooms were ready and waiting for us. The lady at the front desk was very pleasant. She welcomed us warmly and checked us in within 15 minutes. Rooms are clean, breakfast good (especially for kids) Danish, bagels, cereal, hard boiled eggs, waffle maker, juice and coffee, which was very good. Front desk was very
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking time to comment about your recent stay with us.  I am glad to hear that you had a wonderful experience and will return.  We will look forward to seeing you in the near future.

Summary: We have used this hotel for our base whenever we come to Anaheim. I find the service to be excellent and the rooms comfortable especially the beds. It is nice to have a breakfast available. We will certainly be back. I do recommend staying here.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you so much for choosing us each and every time you come to anaheim.  We look forward for to seeing you again.

Summary Heading: 20 Minutes to the Happiest Place on Earth.
Summary: First, there are two of these hotels with almost identical names in Anaheim.  This one is the better of the two, but it is farther away from Disneyland.  If you are going to book this hotel please note that the address is E Katella Ave.  We stayed here on a Friday and Saturday night with two other couples and their children, altogether we had access to 5 rooms for the two nights.  All rooms were identical, some had views depending on which side of the hotel they were located (you pay more for a view).  Beds were all very comfortable, bathrooms new, air-conditioning working.  I also found the rooms to be very sound-proof, I didn't hear the neighbours at all.  Front Desk staff were always friendly and accommodating.  Please note, the rooms do not have safes, not a big deal, just
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you so much for taking time to go on line and write about your experience.  I am glad to hear that you enjoyed it and would return.     Feedback from our guests is very important to us and your input helps with our continuing efforts to provide excellent service and a great stay.  Thank you so much for your business and we look forward to seeing you in the future.

Summary: We arrived here at 2 in the morning and were welcomed by a really nice young man working the night shift - sorry don't remember name but check- in was July 9th.  we stayed 4 nights and were very happy with our lodgings. our room was immaculate, breakfast was okay but take my advice and visit the donut shop about fifty steps away to your left when you leave the front door - really nice people who make real homemade donuts and so many different kinds ... take my advice here and don't leave without going there for the freshest donuts you ever tasted ... they even sell their day-olds - a huge box for $4 ... actually I think Comfort would be smart to serve these at their breakfast bar and just charge a few more bucks for the rooms.) - the walk to Disneyland is a mile but honestly
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  We would like to thank you for taking the time to go on line and talk about your experience.  I am glad to hear it was an enjoyable one.   Feedback from our guests is very important to us and your input helps with our continuing efforts to provide excellent service and a great stay.  Thank you so much for your business and we look forward to seeing you in the future.

Summary: Nice place. Internet Patchy. Rooms fine.  Breakfast area overcrowded. Best get there before 7am or at the end as queues unbelievable.  Staff a good laugh and welcoming.  First night the fire alarm went off at 4.30 am. Listened for the stampede to the fire exits.. False alarm. Un nerving non the less.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Sorry about the issue with the alarm, but was taken care of in a timely manner.     Feedback from our guests is very important to us and your input helps with our continuing efforts to provide excellent service and a great stay.  Thank you so much for your business and we look forward to seeing you in the future.

Summary Heading: Close to sports at Anaheim Stadium and Honda Center
Summary: Convenient location to attend Angels baseball games or events at Honda Center-long walk/short drive-and right off Interstate 5 freeway but not too noisy. (TIP: if driving to baseball games, best to park in outside lots for $10 since wait to get out of stadium parking is ridiculously long with thousands of cars trying to get out from limited number of exits.)  Hotel business center is an enclosed, quiet room with two computers and a printer, much better than the usual Comfort Inn computer in a lobby corner.  Complimentary breakfast is crowded but eating area is large with many tables and chairs, needed during the summer months when hotel is full of Disneyland visitors. Front desk sells Park tickets, etc. There is a well-organized book of pre-printed maps to area attractions given
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  We would like to thank you for taking the time to go on line and talk about your experience. We are doing our best to help the environment by conserving energy.  That is the main reason we leave the refridge off.  I am sorry you didn't find a sign for each room should have one.  Feedback from our guests is very important to us and your input helps with our continuing efforts to provide excellent service and a great stay.  Thank you so much for your business and we look forward to seeing you in the future.

Summary: We stayed in a 2 queen room for 3 nights while going to Disneyland. The hotel is clean. The staff are friendly & helpful. The ART (bus) picks up near the hotel & will take u to disney. We had a car so we didn't use the bus. Disney parking is maybe 10 min fr the hotel & the park is maybe 15-20 min (due to traffic). Newport beach is approx 30 min & Hollywood maybe an hour. Our room was clean & comfortable. We were facing the Fwy & could hear the cars but it didn't keep us awake. There were 5 of us & we never ran out of hot water during the showers. The free breakfast was good. they had waffles, eggs, sausage, cereal, yogurt, etc. parking is free & we never had issues finding a spot. The neighborhood was ok & felt safe. There r plenty of stores, restaurants & shopping in walking
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  We would like to thank you for taking the time to go online and tell about your experience.  Feedback from our guests is very important to us and your input helps with our continuing efforts to provide excellent service and a great stay.  Thank you so much for your business and we look forward to seeing you in the future.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay..no frills but it's all that you need
Summary: The rooms are very clean and have everything that you need.  The beds are extremely comfortable and the staff is very friendly.  The rooms were always made up and cleaned everyday, even if we were late departing.  The staff didn't always take all the garbage away out of the room. The hotel is close to Disneyland and nice restaurants.  The freeway is also close, but there was absolutely no noise traffic that we heard.  The only complaint---there is only one way in and one way out of the hotel and you have to do a u turn at a street down the way to be able to go the other direction.    The outside pool is great, but towels were rarely available.  We only used the free breakfast once, and it was so busy, we didn't take advantage of it again.  The kids didn't like too many items
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for staying with us.  I am glad that you picked us and you were not disappointed.  We hope that you will come back soon and bring your family.

Summary Heading: Enjoyed our stay - great value vs on-site resort hotels
Summary: We were only in Anaheim for 2 days to do Disneyland w/our two boys, ages 2 and 3 1/2 years old so we basically just wanted a place to shower and sleep. We needed a nice hotel at a budget price and this was a great hotel for that! I was able to priceline a room for $66/night, $82.18 after taxes and fees. The published rate was $129/night so I was very happy with our rate. The beds were comfy, the room was clean and spacious, wi-fi is free and a substantial self serve breakfast was included. The staff was very friendly. The only complaint I might offer was that the front desk was not willing to give us 2 beds. Apparently when we won the bid for the room on Priceline, it included a queen bed only & since it was booked thru an outside company, they weren't willing to adjust w/o an
Manager Response: Dear Geust,  Thank you for staying with and commenting on line. I am glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay. The hotel meant your expectations. We look forward to seeing you in the near future.

Summary: This hotel was clean, up-to-date, and had all we needed in amenities. The price was low and the room was very nice. We also enjoyed the free breakfast and ample parking. If you are in great shape, and not older, like us, you could likely save the parking price and walk into Disneyland from here.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  I am glad to hear that your stay was wonderful and better then expected.  Thank you for taking time out to comment about it on line and we hope to see you in the near future.

Summary Heading: Breakfast area could use some attention
Summary: We stayed only one night and it was a pleasant stay. Located very close to disney parks.  Rooms are clean and hotel is nice.    The only problem I had with this hotel is the breakfast area which was split into two levels and food was laid out in one narrow, crammed section.  Very congested. They really need to do something about that.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for staying with us and we are going to do some work to the breakfast area in the near future.  I hope that by next year you will come visit and you will see a different area for breakfast.

Summary: Picking a motel for our stay in the Los Angeles area was like finding a needle in a haystack but The Comfort Inn and Suites was perfect in every way.  We paid about $99 per night AND had a room on the Disney side and could see the fireworks.  The bed was comfortable and super clean. Fridge, air conditioning, shower all worked well and the breakfast was good with plenty of space to sit down.  Staff were pleasant and helpful.  We decided on a taxi to Disneyland and the cost with tip was about $12. The front desk made the call for us and we were at the front gates of Disney about 10 minutes later.  Great stay!
