We have recently improved our breakfast for guest, so that when they leave and go about their day they left satisfied, happy and full.  I happen to love the waffles and the English muffins.  The shuttle to Disneyland is also great and very convenient if you don’t want to drive or walk.  Our staff is always ready, willing and smiling to help any and all guest leave happy.  Once again thank you and we can’t wait to serve your lodging needs in the near future.

Summary: We are in our  late 60s we wanted to go to disneyland so off we went  we stayed at the comfort inn &suites 300 east katella ave in Anaheim ca  we got a bus from the air port for a return trip cost about $50  the bus stops at the  door the hotel we were on the 3 rd floor over looking the free way  the rooms were big  very nice very clean  very nice bed and comfie  cland sheets dig tv, on suite bath/shower, very nice. free breakfast all you can eat you name it and it was there  and fruit . the bus to disney out frount costt $5 for one week  per person travel on any bus you like on that fare from hotel to disneyland about 10 min  drive bus comes every  half hour past the door do not buy your tickets from the hotel they will chargs you bouble that  we would stay there again when we
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest, Thank you for your recent comment about our hotel.  I am glad to hear that you found the rooms to be big and the bed to be comfortable.  Thanks for mentioning the breakfast and how good it was we really want our guests to feel as if they are at home when they stay with us.   The shuttle is offered by the city of Anaheim and the time frame that they come to pick up the guest is always an estimate depending upon how busy they may be.  The cost for the shuttle is $4 per adult and that is good for the entire day as many rides as you would like. The shuttle it self costs $3 one way.  I do hope this helps in clarifying the shuttle ticket costs.   Thank you once again for you comment and we hope to serve your lodging needs again in the near future.

Summary Heading: Good location, free parking and breakfast
Summary: This is a nice Comfort Inn and the room was large and appeared have been recently renovated.  The price was really great, just 80 bucks a night.  The beds were comfortable and the breakfast pretty good.  It's not the Grand Floridian, but you aren't paying $400 a night either.  Not much character if you want that to be part of your Disneyland experience.
Manager Response: Dear valued guest, Thank you for your recent stay with us and comment.  I am glad to hear that you liked your stay but wished it was more Disney looking.   We are associated with the brand name and are limited to what we can do but we can make the suggestion.  I am glad you liked the breakfast; I think it is one of the best in the area. I also noticed you found the rooms to be roomy and a nice perk to each room is the fridge and microwave. Thank you once again and we look forward to serving your lodging needs soon.

Summary: My wife and I've stayed here 6 times already and we've never had a problem. I am a GIIIIIANT clean freak and constantly worry about bed bugs. I've never seen any type of bugs in this hotel and never seen bed bugs around the mattress seams. I check everytime and it's always clean. I graduated from a hotel administration program from unlv in 2011 so I know exactly what to look for in a room to know if it's clean or dirty. The breakfast is and has always been very good. I like the egg patties and the waffles. They usually have yummy donuts too. I can't complain about one thing at this hotel, it's always very quiet too. it's always a great price too, not cutting into the wallet terribly. Thanks to the GM who is keeping the hotel clean because that is my number one concern staying in
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest, I am so glad that you noticed how much pride we take in making sure that our property is in tip top shape.  The house keeping staff will be glad to hear that all their hard work paid off.  I happen to love the breakfast as well and think it has a lot to choose from and the bonus is that it’s included and you feel like we want you well fed.  We do our best to be competitive and keep our prices affordable and also include all that we offer for that low price. We thank you and look forward to seeing you soon.

Summary: Stayed one night.  Trip was to visit family and not Disney-related.  Room was clean and quiet, bed was very comfortable, bathroom was large.  We did not use the in-room fridge and microwave, but very nice to have.  Free parking and location very convenient.  Lots of choices for the free breakfast including make-your-own waffles.    On the minus side, the towels were thin and frayed, there were signs for vending on our floor, but only vending machine was on 1st floor and it was not fully stocked.  Staff was available but not very friendly.    Will I stay again?  At the price I got, maybe.  Otherwise, I'm sure I can get better.
Manager Response: Dear valued guest, Thank you for taking time out to comment about our hotel and you recent stay.  I am glad to here that you liked the hotel over all.  You did seem to enjoy your stay.  I am sorry to hear that you found some things to be an issue.  I will make sure that house keeping knows about the towels and to make sure we discard the old ones.  I am sorry for the inconvenience but yes we only have the vending machines on the first floor and ice makers on the other floors. I also see you found the staff to be unpleasant.  I want to say that we have spoken to them and I thank you for bring that to our attention.  We want all our guests to feel comfortable, liked and happy while they stay with us.  So please understand we value you comments and take them seriously and I hope that next time you plan a stay near Disneyland you do decide to choose us and we will make sure your stay is a happy one.

Summary: I stay with Comfort Suites on my business travels so I figured it would be a great place to stay with the family on our Disney Trip. Great Choice! Room was clean roomy and the fridge/micro is great. Breakfast was busy but good. The staff at the front counter were great with all the questions I had. The hotel is next to a shuttle that takes you to Disney + you can get your tickets there.
Manager Response: Valued guest, I am so pleased to hear that you had a great time at our hotel.  Our hotel was built to ensure that our guests feel as if they are at home.  We want you to be comfortable and happy. Having a fridge and microwave in the room really helps when you want a cold drink or to heat up some food in a hurry.  People love our breakfast; I find it to be the best in the area.  I am so glad to hear that the staff was able to help. Not only do we offer the shuttle service for a small flat rate but you can also buy your Disneyland tickets’ too.   Thank you again and we look forward to seeing you soon.

Summary: Our room was adjacent to the road alongside the hotel, it was SUPER noisy! Unless you're used to motorbikes and incredibly loud cars going past your window, you will not be able to cope with this. Breakfast was really plain and simple but did the job. They have unhealthy and healthy options, which is nice. There aren't really any places to eat close to this hotel, you would need to drive around or taxi if you dont have a car to get to anything nice. LA transport sucks, so unless you want to be waiting 30 minutes for a bus, it's best to taxi.  Front desk staff were only half interested in serving you, especially the women. They were rude and if you asked them to call you a cab, they would roll their eyes. There was one gentleman who worked a night shift when we were there who was
Manager Response: Dear guest  Our property was built in the late 80”s and was placed in a great location near Disneyland, the Convention center, The Honda center, the American Sports Arena and close to shopping as well as the freeway. We have had many guests stay at our establishment over the years and no one has told us that it was super loud.  However if you find that to be the case then we do have the fireworks side for $10 more per night.  Our breakfast is one of the best in the area which offers as you said eggs, sausage, waffles, cereal, oatmeal, wheat toast, yogurt, fruit and juices.  We have the garden walk which is full of places to eat less than a mile from us and a 10 minute walk and there are places that also deliver. Unfortunately we have no control over the transportation but there is a shuttle that can take you to the convention center or Disneyland as well as other places. Our staff is trained to assist our guests as best as possible and I am glad to hear that you did get the help that you needed.  I am also glad to hear that your stay was good in the end.    I hope that the next time you are in town that you will stay with us again and I am sure that your stay will be much more enjoyable.

Summary: An exellent hotel for the price. Close to Disneyland, Knotts Berry Farm, Angel Stadium, Honda Centre and many more attractions. Forty minute drive to Hollywood. Great atmosphere and friendly staff.
Manager Response: Dear Guest, thank you for commenting on our hotel and I am glad to hear that you found it to be a great value and a great place to stay.  Our location is perfect in that it’s next to the freeway and time wise great if you want to go to the beach or LA.    Thank you for noticing that our staff does their best to make sure that each guest enjoys their stay with us and leaves with a smile.  We look forward to serving your lodging needs in the future.

Summary Heading: A great choise for beautiful staying
Summary: It was a wonderful stay a the comfort. Wonderful ... It was excellent !!!! Great !! We thought we're going to stay just for 3 nights and at the end we stied all most a week!!! Helpful staff, great, comfort, big clean room!!! It was quit close to Disney and not so far from L. A. The breakfast was small but still a good start for the day. Over all together it's a big value for mony.
Manager Response: I am glad to hear that you loved it here and ended up staying even longer.  We do our best to make sure each guests' stay is enjoyable and memoriable.  I hope that you took advantage of the shuttle that we offer.  We have recently improved our breakfast so hopefully next time your in you get a chance to try it.   Once again thanks for taking the time to write a review about our property and we truly appreiate you taking the time out to do that. We look forward to seeing you and your family in the near future.

Summary: We totally enjoyed our two night stay here while visiting Disneyland.  The Hotel is very well kept, clean rooms and very comfortable beds. The breakfast bar was wonderful, free internet, and clean pool and jacuzzi.  All 8 of us had a very comfortable stay.  We highly recommend this hotel!  The "freeway noise" that others mentioned was very minimal, we slept soundly.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Enjoyed my stay at this hotel, had full size fridge and a micro the bed was very comfortable and shuttle services were regular, would I return to this hotel yes I would, brekkie came with the room, the only thing lacking was no restaurant and it's about a 5 min walk to several and the garden walk shops and theatre, it was clean and well maintained.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We spent 5 nights at the Comfort Inn in Anaheim. We had a very frustrating check in process, as the desk attendant asked if she could photo copy our ID--of course, that's a reasonable request. However, she did not tell us she would be photo copying our credit card also. This seemed to be a huge invasion of privacy and not PCI compliant. I've worked in the hotel industry for over 8 years, and have never seen or heard of a policy such as this. I was told by the desk clerk that it's a policy to prevent charge backs from card holders, however this makes no sense to me. I definitely do not appreciate my ID and credit card photo copied and available to others. After checking in, we went to take a nap after a long day of travel. To my disgust there was black hair in the bed. The girl
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed here for a few days to attend a convention.  The location was very central--walking distance to Disneyland, Convention Center, Bubba Gump's restaurant.  It's also right on the bus line if you don't mind waiting for the bus.  The room was exceptionally clean, beds comfortable, and free breakfast was great--waffles, fruit, pastries, juices, cereals, etc.  The room even had a working refrig and microwave, iron and ironing board.  The computer room was also a nice ammenity.  Parking was plentiful and free--a rarity for some Anaheim hotels.  The customer service and maintanance staff are excellent.  I had a slow draining sink the first day and it was fixed by the time I returned to my room.  The reason I don't give 5 stars is that my room was on the second floor, on the
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel is within Walking distance to disneyland, there was a good breakfast, extremely good customer service & nice room. I enjoyed the time at this hotel. Would recommend it for sure.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We came to this hotel for a Tupperware convention, and a bunch of us conventionees stayed here.  The pool was nice, the staff was friendly, and the room was outstanding.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We are a retired couple visiting family in the area. Stayed five nights at this inn. Room was clean and bed very comfortable. Breakfast had plenty of food, and some "hot" items like biscuits and sausages. On one morning there was a crowd, but it was not overwhelming. Staff was friendly and attentive to issues and they acted promptly. This hotel is a short drive to Disneyland (about 1 mile), so there were many families there, but it wasn't noisy. Location is right off Santa Ana Fwy (I-5) which we found convenient, but (again) not noisy. I would definitely stay here again. It was a very positive experience.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed one night at the Comfort Inn and Suites in Anaheim. This one is 300 E. Katella Ave.  I was in Anaheim for 1 night business trip.  Very comfortable and clean hotel.  Rooms were great, breakfast in the morning was not bad but when you are on the run and how busy the Disneyland Area is it worked.  Small pool and nice size spa.  I was on the freeway side of the hotel and heard the noise early in the evening but once it got later and I fell asleep no problem.  Rooms have a microwave and a good size mini fridge.  Not one negative comment I can say about this place.  It was a great value for the month of August less than a mile from Disneyland.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Excellent rooms, great value, noisy AC though
Summary: Arrived at the hotel late in the evening after a long trip from Northern California. The checkin was great. Somewhat annoying that the back and side exits are unaccessible even with your key card after 5 pm.   Some trucks with trailers (big rigs) occupied at lot of the parking in the back, but we managed to find a spot.   Wifi Internet Access is included and that was great only hassle was to have to re-login all the time through their portal. Given that they have use a very obvious common username password scheme where all users use the same username/password, this provides no value. They would be better off offering access to an encrypted connection using a WPA2-PSK key common to all. This way iDevice users would not have to re-authenticate whenever you are back in reach of the
Manager Response: Thanks to your comments we were able to fix the doors. We also appreiate your understanding in regards to the big trucks as the back of the hotels is where they need to park.  As for the wifi we appreiate ate you noticing that there may be a easier way and we will pass that on th our tech people. The reason we keep the breakfast the same is because especially over the weekend the park opens up early and they like to eat and leave. We haven't received any complains reqarding the waps but we will pay attention to that.  thank you for your time We look forward to serving you in the future

Summary: We stayed here for five nights with our 7 month old son. A little worried because of some of the reviews, but that all changed once we checked in. The front desk staff were very nice and checked us in quickly. The room was large enough to set up crib, play mat and still have room to move around. nice flat screen and an actual cable box. this game in handy as there was access to on demand kids shows.   Pool was nice and clean. All in all nice clean hotel. We were on the freeway side second floor and were not bothered by any noise.
Manager Response: I am so glad to here that you decided to stay with us and enjoyed it very much. thank you for taking time out of your day to let us know that. we appreiate that.

Summary Heading: HUGE Mistake-don't stay here, there are PLENTY of other options that are probably better
Summary: This hotel is in a great location near Disneyland, but that's its ONLY redeeming quality.   The staff is RUDE and not helpful at all-the breakfast attendant gave attitude if she was asked to do something crazy like to please refill the coffeepot which was empty, and the front desk staff wasn't much better. They too had attitude, and weren't even helpful in pointing out the location for the ART shuttle stop, just pointing to the right and saying it was "over there." Thank you that's very helpful, because "over there" couldn't be anywhere to the right of the hotel or anything like that. We returned early from the parks the second day around 4:00 to find our room still had not been cleaned, even though the maid had been directly next door when we left around 10:00 that morning. We
Manager Response: I understand your issue, however we do our best to serve each and every guest in timely manner. We also do our best to explain to guest exaclty where the shuttle is to pick them up.  It may be a bit confusing but we do our best to explain. I am sorry that your room wasn't clean maybe you had a don't disturb sign up at the time the house keeper was there but you are more then welcome to call us an let us know you need house keeping and we will take care of it right away. Once again I am sorry for the breakfast, however we offer hot eggs, sauages, waffles, 3 kinds of cereal, toast, muffins, donuts, yugart, hot coffee and tea and we make sure the milk is cold by keeping it in containers that keep it that way. We also ways keep this hotel as clean as possible. if there is any issues our staff takes care of it right away.  Hopefully your stay with us in the further will be a pleasant one and I hope we get a chance to serve you again.

Summary: this is a good hotel with very comfortable beds and clean rooms, the pool was clear and warm, a good options when you visit disneyland with the family.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your response and we truely appreiate you taking the time out and commenting on us.

Summary Heading: Nice place to stay when visiting Disneyland
Summary: We have stayed at a number of hotels around Disneyland - this is one of the nicest for the price.  Very convenient to get to Disneyland and dining.  The pool and spa were nice for the afternoon.   Make sure you ask for a room away from the freeway - it is noisy.  They charged $10 extra for changing but it was much quieter.  The room was nicely decorated.  A few minor issues - The sinks were a bit tall for my kids to reach.  The air conditioner sounded like a jet taking off as it turned on during the night. Breakfast was nice and staff was courteous.  I would stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your feed back but I would like to mention that the only reason we charge more for the other side is because you are able to see the Disneyland fireworks from that side. I hope that the front desk was able to help you with the a/c they are there to assit in any way that they can. So glad to here that you liked the breakfast we just added the hot eggs and sauage as well as yogart. Our staff thanks you for noticing how courteous they are they do their best.  thank you and we look forward to seeing you in the future.

Summary: I placed a reservation for this hotel back in April.  We were unable to stay there, so I called and canceled.  I was not aware that I would be charged anyways for one night stay.  It was very unfortunate that I was charged over 100 dollars for a room that was worth about 50 dollars.  I called three times to speak to the general manager about my concerns, and no one returned my phone calls.   I understand that it was my responsibility for canceling, but a family member got sick the night before we were supposed to leave.  I will never stay with Comfort Inn again, due to the fact I was not treated with respect.  They got there money and now I do not even matter.  My recommendation is to stay with the Red Lion Inn on Harbor Blvd.  Amazing customer service, they even upgraded our
Manager Response: We have a 24 hour cancellation policy that we let each and every guest know about when they make a reservation. I understand that you were unable to show up but however we were unaware of that.   I understand you may be upset but we do our best to treat each and every guest with care and respect.  Hopefully in the future we can show you that thank you and hope serve you in the furture

Summary: CHECKIN – by a young lady who was being trained & was supported by a manager. Great service & recommendations. ROOMS – one of the newest & nicest Comfort Inns we have stayed in on this trip. Rooms are spacious and the furnishings & bed are lovely. Huge spa. EXTRAS - breakfast was nice, wifi connection good, able to print out travel details in business centre. SHUTTLE - $4 all day shuttle to Disneyland runs every 20mins. FOOD – 5min walk to "Garden" shopping centre - excellent selection of restaurants to suit all budgets. LOCATION - handy to bus route that connects with Amtrak.
Manager Response: I am so pleased to here that you enjoyed your stay with us and used the services that we provide. Yes many people find our location very convient for them , the fact that we are so close to Disneyland, and the convention center and even the Angel stadium.   as well as shopping and the freeway is very accessible.  thank you so much for you comments and time to write them and we look forward to serving you in the future.

Summary: We stayed here for 4 nights on the first leg of our 2 weeks in USA. Great base for visiting Disney and Anaheim. 15 minute walk to the Disney gates or catch the shuttle to and back for $4 per day each. (just remember the buy the ticket before you get on!).  Loved the complimentary breakfast every morning. Tea, coffee, toast, boiled eggs, cereal, danishes, fresh juice or make your own waffles!. Save you bucket loads if you brought the kids. Ours were at home in Melbourne :o. Simple, clean and comfortable. Great value if your travelling - especially since you hardly spend any time in the room anyway.  Would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: thank you so much for taking time out to let our future guests know about our hotel. we appreiate you taking time out to write this and I am so glad to here that you enjoyed it and I can't wait to meet you again.  We have recently redone our hotel and I am glad you liked it. Yes the shuttle is a convience for anyone. it's reliable and offered at a great price.  thank you and we look forward to seeing you soon

Summary: We have been to Disneyland four times prior to this trip.  Our daughter has been there since she was six and is now 14.  We've always thought it was easiest/most convenient to be right across the street from the resort.  Prices for the "maingate" hotels we've previously stayed at were way too high for the quality of the hotels.  (The hotels are getting runned down and the quality is going down.)  Our park hoppers from AAA included free parking at the park.  We decided, therefore, to look for hotels in the area, but no longer needed one in "walking distance."  I found the price for this Comfort Inn to be way too good to pass up; and, the photos on the web looked great.  WE LOVED IT!!!!  The hotel was extremely clean; we felt so welcomed with the wonderful service from the front
Manager Response: I am so glad to here that your stay was wonderful.  Thank you so much for your comments and as many guest know we are very close to disneyland and the angle stadium, the honda center and the convention center.  we do our best to make each and every guest fill as close to being at home as possible. the shuttle is very convenient for those who don't want to drive or walk. it picks you up behind us and drops you in front of Disneyland.  WE have a laundry service that any guest can use all you need to do is drop it off early morning and you have it back by 6 and the prices are reasonable.  thank you again and we look forward to seeing you soon.

Summary Heading: Great Place - My new Idaho Falls destination.
Summary: This is a really nice, new, clean and quite hotel with extremely friendly and attentive staff.  The only problem I have with giving it a rave review is a selfish one... I don't want it to get so popular that I wont get a room there when I go to Idaho Falls. There is a great little Mexican joint across the parking lot with fantastic food or else if you dont feel like a heavy meal the hotel usually has some complimentary soup available. They have a nice breakfast in the morning
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: HORRIBLE Hotel for Disneyland!  Bugs, Rude Management, Noisy!!!
Summary: The hotel is on the corner of two very busy streets.  You can easily  hear the traffic noise in your room.  The Disneyland shuttle which stops on the road alongside the hotel makes a loud, horrible screeching noise every time it lowers one side to let riders on.  The shuttle runs until midnight some nights.  If you like things quiet, do NOT choose this hotel!  The information the hotel staff gives regarding the shuttle to Disneyland is incorrect.  The shuttle does NOT stop right outside the hotel.  You have to walk down a busy street to wait for the shuttle.  You have to stand next to the busy street while you wait for the shuttle.  There is no place to sit.  It would not be safe for parents with young children.    The shuttle does NOT run every 20 minutes as stated.  We waited
Manager Response: We deal with hundred's of guest each week and we do our best serve each and every one of them to the best of our ability.  We try to make sure each and everyone of their needs it meant in a resonable manner.  The shuttle is controlled by the city of Anaheim and it's a service that they offer to our guest as well as guest from other hotels.  they do their best to make sure the driver is there every 20 mins but as you know when it gets busy then that can delay them.  We offer passes on a 3 day bases or a 5 days bases which again is given to us by the city.  We take time an care to clean each and everyroom to the best possible ability we have and we make sure breakfast has a variety of things and is enjoyable for all our guests.  the internet may slow down depending upon who many are using it at once but again no one else had told us anything about that.  We maintane our pool and spa on a daily bases to ensure our guests can use it. we take all responses seriously and look into them in a timely manner.  thanks for your comments and we look forward to serving you in the future.

Summary: Stayed here for 2 nights after arriving into Los Angeles before heading to Nevada desert.  Hotel is in a safe location close to a shopping mall with good choice of restaurants (within walking distance).  Hotel is located next to a freeway ramp so easy to find and navigate to other parts of LA.  On arrival at hotel, staff were pleasant and check-in only less than 10 minutes for our 4 rooms.  Rooms were clean and quite spacious, everything in working order.  Beds were comfy and bedding smelt clean and fresh.  Shower worked perfectly with plenty hot water at peak time.  Our room located on 4th floor overlooking freeway and was not noisy at all but others in our group were on 1st floor and said traffic got noiser at peak morning rush hour but not too bad.  Buffet breakfast was
Manager Response: thank you for your comments and I am glad to here that you enjoyed your stay with us.  Our house keepers do an excelent job at making sure each and everyroom is ready and up to our standards for each guest.   Our breakfast has a lot to choose from as you have mentioned and we thank you for enjoying it especially those waffles.  yes the weekend can be busy and we appreiate you understanding that. thats another great thing about our hotel it's free parking.  once again thank you for your response to your stay with us and we look forward to seeing you in the future.

Summary: I chose this hotel based on previous reviews and price and I was not disappointed. The rooms and other areas of the hotel were spotless and well prepared, down to the fanned washcloths. We did not use the shuttle to Disneyland but drove and parked for $15. It would have been a very short drive but I misunderstood the directions so we took the scenic route. The breakfast was good and there's plenty of seating. We didn't use the pool or spa. There was a nice work-out room but I didn't use that either. All in all, a good stay and I would definitely stay there again.
Manager Response: I am so glad to here you enjoyed your stay and we even went beyond what you expected.  thanks so much for that. and I hope that in the near future we can have you stay with us again.  we look forward to seeing you in the future.

Summary: I initially chose this hotel because there is a bus that stops here that  takes you to Disneyland and back. You can ride unlimited for $4/day for adults or $1/day for kids aged 4 & up, and there are discounted multi day passes available as well. This is a huge savings over the ridiculous price they charge for parking at the park. The hotel itself was very nice. It was spacious, clean, quiet, and comfortable, and the staff was very friendly. The hot breakfast daily was a nice treat too. The only negative thing I have to say is that we were not happy that they refused to give us a room facing the park (so we could see the fireworks at night) because of the rate we paid. If the hotel was busy, I could see their point, but there were plenty of empty rooms available. Not a great way
Manager Response: I am glad that you enjoyed our hotel and would recommed it to anyone as well as come back.  I understand that you wanted a room with a view of the fireworks but as you were told that is the view side and yes we charged more.  thank you for taking time out to comment and thanks for staying with us and we hope to see you soon.

Summary: We were so pleased with this Comfort Inn & Suites.  Our room on the 5th floor was spotlessly clean, very spacious and well appointed with a refrigerator and microwave, hair dryer, coffee maker - I have paid a lot more for a lot less!  Make sure you ask for a room facing the parking lot and not the freeway onramp for a perfect view of the Disney fireworks.  The shuttle bus deal was fantastic.  $4 for all day travel between Disneyland and the hotel - this allowed us to return for a rest mid-day.  The room was quiet and comfortable and the pool/spa area very refreshing.  Although I am sure the place was filled with children, there were no issues with noise.  Loved the free internet and gym amenities.  The breakfast was perfect - you don't need more than this and a great way to
Manager Response: thank you so much for taking time out to write a comment about our hotel and the fact that you enjoyed it so much makes it that much better.  we try to offer many things in our price so that guests get the best for their money.  am so glad that you noticed that we offer the free wifi, the free parking , the free business center, the free fitness center, and the free breakfast.  thanks so much and we look forward to serving you in the near future.

Summary: The hotel is located about a 30 minute walk from Disneyland.  This is both a good and bad thing depending on your point of view.  The hotel supposedly has a deluxe breakfast but 4 types of cereal doesn't count in my opinion.  It's got your usual assortment of items however it was never busy so very easy to find a spot to sit down.    No on site laundry but there's a strip mall with grocery store/laundromat and other shops next door.  The hotel says it's been newly renovated but my room had the old linens which looked very faded.    The room is very spacious with a fridge and microwave provided.    The biggest complaint I have is that the business centre computers are very slow.  I couldn't even use them on several occasions as it took forever to get onto the Internet.  Also the
Manager Response: thank you for commenting and thanks for staying with us. we do our best to make sure each guest enjoyes the breakfast which is why we offer it from 6:30 to 9:30 each and every day.  we offer a laundry service that is picked up in the morning and returned in the evening for a reasonable price.  our wifi is used by all our guests and depending upon the time of day if too many people use it then yes it can slow it down but most of the time we don't have these issues.  thank you and we hope to see you in the near future.

Summary: I highly recommend this hotel if you are staying in the Anaheim, CA area near Disneyland & it is located away from the crowd of the park,  in a quiet area.  Service was great, rooms very clean & neat,  the beds are so comfortable to sleep. It has new flat screen TV.  The staff was exceptionally nice, friendly & accommodated our needs with any questions.  Included with the cost morning breakfast with huge waffles, boiled eggs, toast, cereal, juice, coffee & pastries.  No meat with the breakfast but it's still delicious.  Saves money from buying breakfast.  Exercise room & internet room are all included.  Many nice restaurants down the street towards Disneyland which only about 3 blocks away.  They offer concierge service for bus tours & will set that up for you.  It would be good
Manager Response: Valued Guest, We greatly appreciate your wonderful review.  We are always glad to hear back form our guests.  We also thank you for the accurate review of the breakfast and hotel information.   I would like to apologize for the disappointing experience with VIP.  I will make it a point to communicate your feedback to their sales rep. and hopefully they will assist in making these tour/experiences more valuable and pleasant.   Once again thank you for taking out of YOUR time to review our property. Sincerely,  Jeniffer H.

Summary Heading: Very nice hotel close to Disneyland
Summary: Very nice hotel about 10 mins walk from Disneyland. Clean, great restaurant, friendly helpful stuff and free internet.   Rooms were big, bathrooms modern and very comfy bed.
Manager Response: Valued Guest, thank you for taking the time to review our hotel.  We are happy to know we provided the right place for you and your friends with a comfortable, clean and friendly service.  It is our hope to be your lodging preference on your next visit to Anaheim, California.  Once again, thank you!  Sincerely, Farzana Kakar

Summary: We stayed for 6, er I mean 7 nights.  I say that because I made the reservation for 6 nights in error, we were supposed to stay 7.  When we returned to our room we realized our mistake.  The front desk people were very cordial and extended our stay one more night for the same low rate we had obtained online.  I thought that was really nice.  Our room was clean and recently updated.  Overall the hotel was pretty quiet too.  The only odd thing was the bathroom door opened out into the entry area and if open was in the way of the entrance door.  Such a strange setup.  It worked out ok though.  The breakfast bar was nicely stocked each morning and the eating area was always kept neat and clean.  Anaheim Resort Transit stop right outside the front door, very convenient.  Though the
Manager Response: Valued Guest, We appreciate you taking the time to review our property.  And I am glad we had the opportunity to help you with the length of your stay.  I appreciate that you notice the update of our room.  In regards to the bathroom door observation,  I apologize for any inconvenience  this set up might have caused you and your loved ones.  I must say it appeared funny to me too, until I realize how many hotel have the same set up in their restrooms.  I can only assume the idea came out of extra-modern design book.  Thank you for the kind review on the breakfast set up and cleanliness. I also hope you enjoyed the shuttle trip to Disneyland.  Once again thank you very much for your time.  And we look forward to serve you future lodging needs. Best regards, Farzana Kakar

Summary: My wife and I stayed here for 2 nights for a Disneyland visit. We booked late so lots of local hotels were booked full so we decided to try this hotel we've never tried before.  Checkin was easy and pleasant and we received a 5th floor room which was great because I am a very light sleeper and can't stand the noise of someone stomping around above. Our room was unexpectedly large, even with a king bed in there. It had a great little sitting area, a nice flat panel TV, large fridge, powerful A/C with digital temp readout, and nice bathroom. All bed linens were clean and fresh and the room didn't have a musty feel like many do The bed was very comfortable. Honestly we were kind of surprised by the amenities for the relatively low price that we paid.    The free continental
Manager Response: Valued Guest, thank you for such complete review and your experience at our hotel.  We are very happy about your feedback.  It was our delight to present to you and your wife with one of our comfortable and fresh rooms to relax; of course at a reasonable price.  I am also glad you enjoyed our breakfast along with the breakfast-area TV.  Thank you also for noticing the security we provide at our property.  Our intent is not only to make sure you and your wife feel comfortable, but also secure.  In regards to the noise, I am sure the traffic would not have been a problem during your stay; all windows in our rooms are doubled-paned.  The distance to Disneyland as you have mention is relatively close and convenient, thank you for mentioning it!  Once again, I am very glad to hear from you and about your desire to return to our hotel.  We look forward to your next visit.  Sincerely,  Farzana Kakar

Summary: This hotel is a great place to stay. The rooms are clean, not one speck of mold in the bathroom, they even sheet the blanket. The bed was comfortable and the staff polite, welcoming and always smiling from the desk clerks to the maintenance people to the maids. Breakfast is good and they go a bit beyond. The apples and bananas are large, not tiny as you usually get. There are two waffle makers that are always busy. Food is replenished quickly as it gets low. The coffee is good too. The side entrance is convenient. We asked for and got a room facing the Disney fireworks which is best from the top floor but we were on the 2nd and it was ok. Lots of family's were here during our stay. If I were to say anything negative it is that there are only 3 chairs in the lobby which is always
Manager Response: Valued Guest, We are joyous to hear back from you.  We are proud to provide families like yours with a clean, comfortable and well-maintain place to stay, and that is what causes our staff to smile and enjoy helping you along the way.  Thank you for the review on the breakfast and all the feed back on the business center pool and side-entrance.  In regards to the chairs in the lobby I would like to have invited you to take a seat in the breakfast area, all our guest are always welcome to enjoy a family afternoon there.  Once again thank you for your great review and we hope to see you soon.  Sincerely, Fazana Kakar

Summary: We really enjoyed our stay at this Comfort Inn, as the room was great, the beds comfortable and the staff was friendly and helpful.  Although not as close as some of the hotels to Disneyland, the shuttle service bus stop is just outside the hotel (practically curb-side service!) and very convenient. We actually enjoyed it a little more since there seemed to be a bit more peace and quiet throughout.  We slept like babes and enjoyed a nice Contenental breakfast.  We'll be sure to stay here on our next trip to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Valued Guest, it has been our pleasure having you at our property.  We are glad you got to stay out of the chaos and took advantage of the shuttle service.  We are also pleased to hear the compliments about our staff, comfort and continental breakfast.  We hope to see you soon on your next trip to Disneyland.   Best regards, Farzana Kakar

Summary: This hotel I believe is probably one of the nicest hotels in the disneyland area, clean, cool and confident are 3 words to describe this hotel. The beds for the 2 queen bed rooms are comfortable and the pillows are fluffy. Nice flat screen tv, and direct tv was nice. The best part was there office space and fitness room which were both well air conditioned. Ask for the managers special for a discounted rate. Sunday-wednesday $92 a night is well worth it.
Manager Response: Valued Guest, We greatly appreciate your helpful review of our hotel.  It was our pleasure to provide a clean and definitely confortable place for you and your family.  We are glad you got a chance to enjoy our fitness center and our business center.  We look forward to your next visit.   Sincerely, Farzana Kakar

Summary: High Speed Internet, Basic Time Warner Cable, Business Center, Fitness Room... Stay here because you getting the best deal, I've stayed in Comfort Inns and this is the greatest I've seen yet, location is not the closest to Disneyland but you can walk to Anaheim Gardenwalk just go left for about 1/2 mile if you see a Chevron its straight ahead if not you headed the wrong.... If you haven't tried El Pollo Loco its a good chicken restaurant (like KFC but Mexican Grilled Chicken) around the area...  Across the street a Del Taco (not bad place for a snack or quick meal)
Manager Response: Valued Guest, We appreciate the accurate description of our property.  It is exciting to hear back from our pleased guests.  As you mention the Garden Walk is minutes away and is always a place for your family to enjoy and relax at.  We look forward to your next visit.    Sincerely, Farzana Kakar

Summary Heading: A good choice for Anaheim and Disneyland
Summary: This was the first hotel we noticed when we came off the Highway from the East travelling along East Katella Way.   It was conveniently close to the Avis Rental depot to which we had to return our rental car .   The receptionist was well presented, friendly and  on request to see one of the hotels rooms did so without hesitation, offering us other information on the hotels facilities as well. We were allocated a room on the second floor which was spacious, clean, and well presented , a pleasant place to return to at the end of a days sightseeing.
Manager Response: Valued Guest, thank you for the wonderful review.  It was our pleasure making you feel confortable on your trip to Anaheim.  As you mentioned we are conveniently located close to the Interstate 5 and several rental car businesses so, on next spontaneaous visit our staff will be happy to welcome you with a smile and a confortable room.    Thank you,  Farzana Kakar

Summary Heading: Very Happy with our stay...Price was great too
Summary: My husband, myself & 2 grandkids checked in on Sat. evening after a long and tiring day at Knottsberry Farm. Paul was at the front desk & made sure we had the room we requested (facing Disney's fireworks). He was very professional and very pleasant. He answered all my questions. The beds in the room were very comfortable. The air conditioner was a little noisey but not enough to keep us awake. The water pressure in the shower was very strong not like some that just dribble. In the morning we had breakfast there. It wasn't anything extravagant but was great for the price (free). They had cereal, banana's, apples, waffles, toast, english muffins, pastries & hard boiled eggs. When we came down for breakfast Paul was at the front desk & made us feel welcomed. We bought tickets for
Manager Response: Valued Guest, thank you for such kind and descriptive review.  It is alway great to hear back from our guests.  Our front desk staff has been trained to answer all the questions about our surroundings and many other questions you and your familiy might have. Once again thank you for the review and we look forward to your next visit.  Farzana Kakar

Summary: Very good hotel for what we paid.Breakfast was good,rooms spotless.Good choice of channels for the kids to watch a film at night on the plasma screen. Maybe just a little bit too far to walk to Disneyland with small children,but bus is outside hotel. Would have no hesitation in using this hotel again.
Manager Response: Valued Guest, we appreciate your feedback on our televisions and your trip to Disneyland.  It is always our pleasure to offer clean comfortable rooms at great prices, thus we look forward to your next visit.    Thanks again, Farzana Kakar

Summary Heading: Value for money for budget traveller
Summary: We stayed here for 4 nights from Mar 13 to Mar 17 2010. We arrived at 7.30pm, and the check-in was smooth and quick. The front desk personnel was very informative because the first thing we did was looking for place to eat...The room was clean and have no unpleasant smell.  It is not what we have expected for a typical 2 to 3 star hotel. The place is a bit far from Disneyland. It is at the junction of Katella and Manchester, near the freeway, roughly around one and half mile from Disneyland. But we had no problem walking to Disneyland. It can be tiring to walk back at the end of day after you spent the whole day walking in the park. There is public transit called ART though, which conveniently stops at the side of the hotel. Breakfast was simple but adequate for us. My kids love
Manager Response: Valued Guest, We highly appreciate your helpful review.  The front desk has been trained to efficiently answer any questions about our surrounding areas.   In regards to the safe box issue, we do provide safe boxes at our front desk at not cost to our guests.  It is very secure since it requires two different keys to open or close; a key that is kept at the front desk and one that is given to the guest when a box is assigned (each box has its own guest key). Thank you again for your review and we hope to see you soon!!  Farzana Kakar General Manager

Summary Heading: excellant , extremely clean and comfortable and close to disney / convention center
Summary: very business friendly hotel. i would recommend this hotel to all business owners.
Manager Response: Valued Guest,  thank you very much for your review.    We love to have bussiness-men and women like you that are looking for comfort and good freeway-access location.   We look forward to serving your future lodging needs.  Sincerely, Farzana Kakar GM Comfort Inn & Suites

Summary Heading: Good bang for your buck convient location too!
Summary: The price was just right for what we got. The room was very clean, spacious, and a great deal compared to the slough of surrounding motels. Last year we had stayed at the Best Western Stovall's and this trumps that by far. Nice Spacious bathroom, robes were available for the pool and hot tub.  The Continental Breakfast was your typical faire of coffee, juices, cereal, waffle maker, hard boiled eggs, muffins, toast, fruit, and pastries. There was a nice dining area where you could sit down and watch the morning news while eating. Also one bonus was the Coffee was available 24/7 in the lobby.  Location was good, about a 15 minute walk from the Convention Center and Downtown Disney was only a short car ride away. Plenty of food places and even a cute shopping/food court area along
Manager Response: Valuable Guest,  I would like to thank you for the positive review you have given our hotel. It is great to hear back from our guests and about their experience at our property.  We look forward to seeing you again.  Sincerely, Farzana Kakar GM Comfort Inn & Suites

Summary: Hotel check-in was very easy and also accommodating staff who put two family members on top floor so they could get a view of Disneyland fireworks.      Our family members had rooms on both sides of this hotel, our room faced the freeway.    There was a little noise from the traffic, but with aircon on, it wasn't a problem at night.   The room was perfectly okay, and very clean.      The pool and jacuzzi were well looked after, saw staff check the quality of the pool water daily.    The pool maybe a bit on the cool side, but who needs a heated pool in the californian sun!       Breakfast was provided daily, it was good start to the day.   Internet access is 'free' and there are two computers available to use.     We walked to Disneyland, it took about half an hour, walking
Manager Response: Valued Guest,  thank you for such a clear insight.    Our staff is always glad to welcome large families into our hotel.  Also, it is our compromise to provide a safe, clean and comfortable environment at an affordable price.  We are happy to hear how many details you notice about our property and how helpful these were for you during your visit.  Sincerely, Farzana Kakar GM Comfort Inn & Suites

Summary: It wasn't a horrible hotel, it was within walking distance of Disneyland, but not super close. Breakfast was included, but it wasn't very good, just stale muffins and that sort. The room was very cramped and the walls were paper thin, you could hear everything going on everywhere
Manager Response: Valued Guest, I appreciate your willingness to share your recent experince at our hotel.  As you mention we are "not super close" to Disneyland we are about 20 walking and we offer the A.R.T. shuttle tickets at our front desk.   I, also, appreciate to hear your opinion on our Deluxe Continental breakfast in wich we offer a viriety of fresh fruit, cereals, pastries, fresh-made waffles, in addition to hard-boiled eggs, and several other items.  All of these items are delivered to hour hotel on a daily basis.   We look forward to serving your future lodging needs.  Sincerely, Farzana Kakar GM Comfort Inn & Suites

Summary: We stayed in a room with 2 queen beds. Nice room, but kinda small. Comfortable and clean. I would recommend staying in this room type of you are not going to be in the room all day or if you don't have kids to run around because there is not much room to run around. The bathroom was a pretty good size and it was very clean.  We came to this hotel because were going to attend a concert at the Honda Center, which is just down the street, but I wouldn't recommend walking it. Overall, it was perfect for our trip and a good price as well.
Manager Response: Valued Guest,  thank you for taking the time to review our property.  It sound that you stayed in one of our standard room.  But for your convenince our hotel does offer 2-connecting-rooms suites.    It is our hope that you stay at our hotel on your next visit to the Honda Center or many other attractions.    Sincerely, Farzana Kakar GM Comfort Inn & Suites

Summary: We stayed here 5 nights while visiting Disneyland. This is a nice place. The hotel was great from the time we checked in until checkout.  Desk staff is professional in appearance and demeanor.  Housekeeping staff do a great job.  Our room, on the 5th floor, with a great view of the surrounding area, was very clean and neat with all the amenities needed. The continental breakfast was plentiful. And lots of free parking.  All this for about $71 per night.  I couldn't believe it!  This hotel is about a 1/2 mile from Disneyland. Great freeway access. The Anaheim Garden Walk is a block away. Traffic on Katella Ave. can be a little noisy, but so what...the whole area is a tourist attraction. That's why your there!  Book this hotel. You won't be disappointed.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Very Clean - Excellent Rate - Somewhat Noisy On Highway Side
Summary: We really enjoyed our stay at this Comfort Inn.  The rooms are like brand new since being remodeled, the bed was comfortable, the wireless internet actually worked (I have an *old* laptop, with an *old* wireless card), and everything about the hotel was wonderfully clean.  Access to the hotel needs a room key.  The microwave and refrigerator were clean and worked well.    Access to freeways is easy and close, which is a good thing, but if you are on the freeway side of the hotel, the freeway noise is somewhat loud.  We had full days, and at the end of those days we were quite tired, so we slept well, but we did have to use the "fan only" part of the air conditioning/heating system to make some noise that drowned out the freeway noise.  The breakfast area was clean, and the food
Manager Response: Valued guest, we appreciate your positive review about our hotel. It is always a pleasure hearing about how much you enjoy this property.  in regards to the noise coming from the freeway;  I thank you for understanding.  We are close to the I-5, and because of that we have installed double paned windows in all of our rooms.   Once again I thank you for the review.  We look forward to serving your future lodging needs.  Sincerely, Farzana Kakar GM Comfort Inn & Suites

Summary: We recently stayed at the Comfort Inn and Suites for 5 nights and had a very pleasant stay. The front desk staff is very couteous and ready to help. The rooms were very clean. (Take it from me, we run a janitorial service, these rooms were definitely clean). The sheets were changed daily, towels replaced, no souvineers or personal items missing or even touched (again, tested them on that one based on previous reviews). The carpets were clean and did not turn our feet any undesirable colors. The rooms are so quiet, it was great, and the beds.............oh the beds are so comfortable. Also, there was plenty of parking. I loved that we had a view of the Disneyland fireworks! The part my daughter loved the most were the waffles every morning downstairs, along with the cereal, hard
Manager Response: Valued Guest, we would like to thank you for such favorable review.  We are glad that someone in the janitorial service industry has taken time off their busy schedule to post their review of our hotel's cleanliness and comforts.  We take great pride in maintaining our property in the best shape possible.  Again, thank you for your insight.  Sincerely, Farzana Kakar GM Comfort Inn & Suites

Summary: Our hotel stay was excellent, clean rooms, nice breakfast, kids enjoyed the pool and staff was helpful...will come back again.
Manager Response: Valued Guest, it is wonderful to hear about your great time with us. We are very happy about having you back soon.  Thank you!  Sincerely, Farzana Kakar GM Comfort inn& Suites

Summary: I'd bought souvenirs for my grandchildren while visiting Disneyland and felt that they'd be safe in our room while we were away.  When we got back from our last visit, one of them was gone!  We tore the room apart, although we definitely remembered that we'd left one of them on the desk.  The next morning, our day of departure, we decided to look again, "just in case."  My 7 year old granddaughter was crushed !!!  We'd gotten a 3-day Ticket and had gone all 3 days, so we couldn't go back to replace her "treasure."  Upon checking out, I spoke to the manager who assured me that she knew her workers, and that they wouldn't have taken it. No apology of any kind!  When we got home, I found that another souvenir, a little stuffed Minney Mouse key chain was missing.  I didn't know it
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at the comfort inn and suites in Anaheim from April 21-24 and had a very enjoyable stay. We were in town to go to Disneyland. We had booked two rooms both with king beds. Both rooms were very clean and spacious. They both had a microwave and small refrigerators. Check in was smooth and we were actually able to check in about an hour early which was very convenient. When we made the reservation we had only made it for 2 nights. Then we all decided to extend our stay by an extra night so we could also visit Universal Studios and Comfort Inn was very accommodating and was able to get us another room for the last night. The hotel is very close to the Disney Parks yet far enough away not to be in the hustle and bustle of everything. We all enjoyed the free breakfast each
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Hotel Nice - Beware the web site Information
Summary: We have just spent 3 nights at the hotel and found it good value for money - there were just two problems.  The first is that they forgot to clean our room one day but one we contacted the front desk they sent the maid around about half hour later  The second was more serious - We booked the hotel because the web site said it was half a mile from the Honda Center. My wife is in a wheel chair so we were intending to go by foot to avoid trying to get in and out of cabs. However once we got to the hotel we asked them the way to walk and they then told us it was a mile and a half! not exactly walking distance with a wheel chair. When we mentioned this to the front desk they said this was one of a number of error on their web site, but as it was controlled by the corporate people
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel was a really great value for the price. Clean rooms and comfortable beds, newly remodeled bathroom, nice massage shower head, 2 minute drive to Disneyland. Decent continental breakfast with lots to choose from.  Staff was helpful. The only thing we found to be a negative was that there was a removable sliding lock on the windows with no protective barriers. If you have small, curious children who can work a wing nut you might want to keep them away from the windows if you are on a floor higher than the first floor. Only complaint.
Manager Response: none

Summary: It is important that you know the pitfalls of this hotel.  There are many others in Anaheim that are reasonable and clean and comfortable.  I highly recommend the Candy Cane Inn - which is even closer to Disneyland and comparable in price.  We travel from San Diego to Anaheim frequently and thought we would try this hotel due to our regular choices being booked up.  Here's why you must avoid The Comfort Inn and Suites on East Katella Way. First the annoying little things; 1)  The rooms were not clean.  Actually a bit disgusting. They are non-smoking though. 2)  The gym had three nice pieces of equipment and everyone of them was out of service.  Very disappointing as this was a major consideration when we chose this property. 3)  The TV reception/picture was horrible.  Big
Manager Response: none

Summary: What a dissappointment!!!  Asked for a king city view (paid more, should have had a freeway view, much nicer) on highest floor  with new bedding shown in picture  on website and got a room with 2 beds with tattered old bedding/ worn carpet overlooking a bad view of a trailer court and parking lot.  Asked to change. They didn't have a king room ready on third floor and we had to put away some refrigerated items, then leave so, we had to take a room on the second floor with same old look. Pool area had only old tables and chairs....no lounge chairs, and as I wanted to be by the pool one day this was not good!!  Breakfast was ok.  Fairly clean place. We had just stayed at the Menage for 2 nights which was awesome, so this hotel really looked OLD.  Would not stay here again....too
Manager Response: none

Summary: Nice family friendly hotel close to Disneyland.  Staff was friendly and helpful and the room and bathroom were very clean.  The breakfest was typical contenental breakfest plus Belgian Waffles.  The waffles were okay, but not good enough to make the breakfest better than your typical free hotel breakfest. The rooms on the freeway side were a little noisy with freeway noise, but the noise from the air conditionar/heater was  enough to drown it out. On the plus side, there is no parking or much pedestrian traffic on the freeway side, so first floor rooms could keep their curtains open without having to worry about other people looking in.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Terrific Price!  Comfortable Beds!  Very Clean!
Summary: This hotel is completely NON-SMOKING.  I am a non-smoke and can easily smell any hint of smoke ... there was NONE!  While the hotel does showed some wear-and-tear simply due to continual usage, I found it to be VERY CLEAN.  (i.e., in the threshold area from the hall to the room, the carpet was fraying.)  The beds & pillows were very comfortable.  The bath area well stocked with clean towels, bath & hair sundries, hair dryer, and 4 cup coffee pot.  Although we did not take advantage of it, the hotel offers a free (and rather substantial) continental breakfast in the morning.  The only two downsides I came across were MINOR at best.  First, the night clerk (we checked in at 3 a.m.) was very less than friendly.  The second being the 11 a.m. check-out time.  We requested, and were
Manager Response: none

Summary: My boyfriend and I stayed her for 2 nights since we visited Disneyland.  I must say, the price was right (considering the area) and the room was very clean.  We didn't encounter any issues while we were there.  They even had free continental breakfast!  I would definitely recommend staying here if you are on a budget and want to stay in a place that is clean and safe.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great hotel for a quick disney trip!
Summary: Me and my husband stayed here a week before Halloween to enjoy disneyland in the fall. I have to say was not sure about the hotel at first due to other reviews.The hotel is extremely easy to find off the freeway. We were surprised when we where greeted by the hotel employees they where more then helpful to get our room quickly and to get us our shuttle bus tickets to enjoy the park in the evening.The rooms where big and extremely clean! The bed was so comfortable even our shower was a great size. The best nights sleep I have ever had on a off disney property! Great price for your money. My husband loved the breakfast and coffee.The only complaint I had was the Shuttle bus route was a bit long and took you a bit out of the way to get to the park it is not close to the
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed at this property for two days while I was evacuated during the San Diego fires. My room was large and clean, complete with a microwave and refrigerator. The bed was comfortable and the room had wireless internet access.   I believe the entire property is non-smoking. Regardless, my room had no hint of smoke.  Breakfast was OK, nothing great. The highlight seemed to be the "make your own waffle" option.   The hotel is located next to a freeway on-ramp. My suggestion would be to get a room fairly high up (at least the third floor) and with an odd number (odd numbered room faced away from the on-ramp and would probably be quieter).
Manager Response: none

Summary: I have to say that this was one of the best nights sleep I've had in a long time. The beds were wonderful. I even asked the manager the next morning what kind of beds they have. Apparently they have brand new Sealy Backsaver beds. I need to buy one! The room was spacious as was the bathroom. The freeway noise was not an issue. (We did have a room on the opposite side of the hotel though.) The belgian waffle breakfast was a huge hit with the kiddies.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Pretty Good, Can probably find a better room for the money
Summary: We paid over $100 and the room was pretty good. The fridge and microwave was nice to have. The only complaint is that the hallways were really hot!! -no AC. Breakfast was poor and very crowded, so don't use the free breakfast as a reason to stay here.  15 minute walk to Angels stadium so it was good location for staying after the game.  There were lots of cheap hotels in the area, I would guess that another one is newer / nicer / cheaper...
Manager Response: none

Summary: My friend booked this hotel from an internet cafe while we were in San Franciso and it wasnt until after an argument on arrival at the front desk we realised it was her that had got the rates wrong!! The guys there were brilliant... they let us pay for one night until we decided what we wanted to do... we finally decided we were gonna stay three nights there and four in LA itself...but they were so friendly & hospitable we decided to stay the full time there...they dropped us at greyhound stations when we needed to go places...the manager gave us a ride to Universal and spent his day off with us (he'd never actually been himself so was a first for him)... We were made to feel so comfortable during our stay here...We even swapped email addresses and stayed in touch for quite a
Manager Response: none

Summary: This was my second stay at this hotel.  I had stayed once before last Sept. and the stay had been ok.  This time however we had problem after problem, including a manager that was not customer service oriented.  When checking into this hotel we were told that even though we had a confirmation for 2 queens and a roll-a-way that they couldn't provide that for us.  The women working at the front desk were somewhat helpful but the manager was irritated that he had to accommidate us.  We never had enough towels, the breakfast was basic, room conditions were far below other Comfort Inns.  They charged us for the roll-a-way that they wouldn't allow and then we got the run-around when we wanted them to remove the charge.  We have stayed in many Comfort Inns and would never come back to
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Average accomodations, not recommended for families
Summary: In researching Disneyland area hotels for our trip this year, I discovered that I did not post a review for where we stayed last year, The Comfort Inn & Suites Anaheim, Disneyland Resort.  Overdue, but here it is.  First things first: this hotel was fairly cheap.  We got a rate of around $65/night for one king bed.  Many other Disney area hotels were charging (and still do) twice that for similar accomodations, so it is a good value.  The room was just fine--the bed was fine, the room was fairly spacious and had a mini-fridge, which is very handy.  There was a pool and hot tub and the free breakfast is more then adequate--a selection of cereals, pastries, muffins, fruits and make-your-own waffles.  If you have a room facing the parks, you can see some of the fireworks in the
Manager Response: none

Summary: Do not stay here. Public area Rugs disgusting, Wallpaper in hotel room peeling off, no stopper in the sink, shower head did not work. Upon check in guest next too me was lodging complaint. TV had terrible reception - could not watch it. This hotel charges top dollar and is not worth the money.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Our family of four just returned from a trip to Southern California.  We stayed at this property for five nights.  Ideally, we'd have preferred a property closer to Disneyland.  However, for $63.20 plus taxes per night, and the fact that we had a rental car, we felt this worked out well.  We had a room on the 5th floor facing the freeway.  Freeway noise was never a problem.  The room was larger than expected.  It appeared the carpets and mattresses were recently replaced or in the process of being replaced.  The air conditioning unit was one of the better we've had to deal with because we could actually set a comfortable temperature.  No complaints about the housekeeping:  our room was cleaned and the bathroom necessities (i.e., towels, soap, and shampoo) were replenished daily.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My family and I were very unhappy with the hotel, there was prostitution going on the  premises. Our first night there, prostitutes were making solicitations in front of my sister's hotel room, the next morning my brother in law complained, the hotel moved us to a upstairs room in the front. The next night there the prostitutes were going up  and down the stairs in the front of the hotel near our rooms again. No matter where we moved this was going on. I have a 7 year old  and he now knows what protitutes and pimps are because of this. My brother in law complained again to the manager that night. Nothing was done, he was told that they call the police but they don't show up.  I have reason to believe that this sort of thing goes on there all the time, and we were the first to
Manager Response: none

Summary: The room smelled from the paint fumes, the floor under the newly laid carpet had a hole in it so large my kids had to jump over it to use the bathroom. The shower did not work, and we were given a key to use a different room to shower in at the other end of the building at 8am. The comfoters were filthy. If other hotels hadn't been booked, we would have never stayed! It was disgusting. The front desk staff were uncaring and rude! Never again if that's the kind of service that is considered acceptable!!!!!!!

Summary Heading: Pleasant and clean but nothing special.
Summary: We stayed here during Spring Break to go to Disneyland. While all the other motels were full this one had openings. It is about 1.3 miles to walk and that is long after a full day. The surrounding neighborhood is low income housing and quick marts, no Disneyland influence on that part of Katella Ave. It is convenient to I-5, the on ramp is right next to the motel. Get a room facing Disneyland if you can, you can see the fireworks at night but don't pay extra for it because they are far away. The other side is right next to the freeway. The shuttle takes you to the park entrance if you don't want to walk (with some stops on the way). The shuttle stop is on a busy street with no bench and the landscaping on that side of the building is non existent.  The room was just fine for the
Manager Response: none

Summary: We decided to go to Knott's on the spur of the moment and booked this hotel the night before.  Reservations in the area were hard to come by.  This hotel is a bit of a drive, maybe 10-15 minutes, from Knott's.  It is right by the freeway...so you can hear traffic in your room unless you run the a/c.  The hotel and rooms were reasonably clean and neat.  The beds were pretty hard and the pillows were very, very, very thin.  Our 4th floor window was one that opened and it was missing a screen.  The bathroom sink was missing a drain stopper/strainer.  The shower faucet was pretty sad.  The TV was pretty sad too...terrible cable picture.  Breakfast was the typical hotel fare.  The staff was annoyingly  lax in keeping tables clean.    All in all, if we could have found somewhere
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Old, Dingy, and Dangerous for Kids
Summary: I stayed here with my husband and my two kids, because we were able to get a room for $67 a night, and all the hotels across the street (where we have stayed before) were running around $100-$130.  Boy do I wish I had paid the extra $$ because this hotel ruined our trip.  The furnishings were old and dingy, the room smelled musty, everything was old and gross.  The pool was too dirty to swim in.  The hotel is WAY too far from the park to reasonably walk, especially if you have kids with you.  The continental breakfast is okay-- One of the few good things.  The WORST part of this hotel was the location of the hotel's ART shuttle to the park—TERRIBLE location!!  Absolutely unacceptable, especially if you have small children.  The “shuttle stop” is located on an EXTREMELY BUSY
Manager Response: none

Summary: This motel was a good value.  The rooms, although showing some wear, were clean, and each day the room was made up and new towels were provided.  I suspected that it wasn't too close to Disneyland, even though it says "Maingate", not sure who's gate they are talking about.  It is about one mile from Disneyland.  It is about a 20 minute walk, or you can buy a bus shuttle for $3.00 which is good for the entire day.  BEWARE!!! The machine at the motel that dispenses the tokens does not give change.  Put in a $10 for a three dollar ticket, and guess what, you just paid $10 for your three dollar ticket.  After you do this, you'll see it printed on the machine that it doesn't give change, but it is very easy to miss since you assume that it would naturally give change.  I didn't use
Manager Response: none

Summary: My husband and I stayed there for the first time in October...May I say, the HOT TUB was great,the room was large,very very clean,the breakfast was great(make your own belgian waffles,cereals,fruit,coffee,juices,cocoa,milk,toast,bagels,english muffins,and of coursejelly....if you don,t think thats enough breakfast...don,t book a hotel with a free breakfast..waste your money at denny,s or mcdonalds..The location seemed far away,but the shuttle for 3.00 all day got us there in no time.we didn,t see any roaches but they have crickets(one got in our room!) but my husband took it back outside..all in all it was very nice..thank-you Comfort Inn for a nice place to stay.

Summary: The Comfort Inn & Suites was nicely located - close enough to everything you need, far enough for a nice walk when you ate too much at Downtown Disney.  Nothing could beat the walk from the Disney parks on a balmy evening, with the rows of towering palm trees down Katella Ave and the moon rising over the distant mountains, it was a great local.  The hotel itself was nice; the staff was friendly and accommodating.  Our plane was early, as was our arrival at the hotel, the staff let us check in two hours early, so we got a wonderful naptime in before heading to dinner at ESPN Zone!  Our room was neat and clean.  No bugs or other nasty critters to be seen.  The only complaint I had was the goofy shower head, you know, the kind you normally get in hotels, the kind that spray all
Manager Response: none

Summary: We've stayed for 3 nights, 6-9 October. Rooms were clean, breakfast was very good comparing to most same class motels we have been to in the US (though you got to get up early to catch a table). 10-15 minutes walk from Disneyland or a 3$ all-day shuttle just in front of the motel. Price, through Web, was very attractive: 60$ per night. Overall: recommended.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Nice Deal but will look for another place next time...
Summary: My wife and I had our first stay in the Disneyland area and stayed at this hotel. Staff at the front desk wasn't the friendliest you could ever find. Got a room with the view of the freeway and soundproofing was not good. Had trouble sleeping because of the traffic noise. The free continental breakfast was just OK. They sell Disneyland tickets at the front at a discount so that's convenient.  Good value but would probably look for another on our next visit.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My mom and I arrived at this hotel...  and when we went into our room, a cockroach went running across the bathroom floor.  It was disgusting.  Then, when I went down the hallway to check out because I was NOT going to stay in a cockroach infested room, I saw another one in the hallway!   We weren't even in the room for 5 minutes before we left.  When we went to the front desk to check out, there was a man there complaining about how his AC didn't work.  Anyway... the front desk attendant said that they have had that problem with cockroaches before.  The only positive thing is that we were able to check out and not have to pay!  I would never go there again!

Summary: Pulled in almost off the offramp which was nice, parking was good, and close. I opened the room door and immediately was hit with the most awful smell. It smelled like a cat had sprayed down the place for a few days. I picked up the phone, asked if they allowed pets, they said no, I told them this room smelled like cats and they said, " no problem come down and swap keys. Second room was not smelly, but a bit stale. Dated interior, a little worn. Refrigerator was barely cold and had a ring of soaked carpet around it. We booked because of the fridge/micro and close proximity to disneyland. Turns out it's physically not far but with the lay of the roads (which you can't walk) it was really far, we had to drive and pay for parking for disney. The staff was courteous, the room only

Summary: We had a great room facing Disneyland.  The fireworks were great to see, even better than being at Disneyland itself.  The breakfast was very good and had a good variety. Summary Heading: Great for the budget conscious traveler
Summary: I have liked most Comfort Inns we've stayed at and this was no exception.  I stayed here with my husband on vacation.  We didn't have our children with us, but I would highly recommend this hotel for people traveling with children who want to stay on a budget.  The price was right and the room was clean.  There was also a microwave in the room so you could save money eating in your room instead of eating out.  They also serve a big continental breakfast.  We were there in February and we were the only ones in the jacuzzi and pool.  It was a nice place to stay.

Summary: We chose this hotel after reading reviews and it was exactly as we expected.  We needed a basic hotel close to Disneyland at a great price.  The front desk staff were very gracious. Summary Heading: Good value, bad service booking sightseeing
Summary: My Wife and I were on vacation and also stayed on this Hotel. The price is fair compared to the standard on the hotel. Its clean and has a good location in Anaheim.  Our only problem was the Indian/Pakistan people that worked the reception when we arrived, they basicly sold us the sightseeing where they made the largest profit, instead of giving us the best value. They sold us a Coach sightseeing of LA, which was terrific, but we also wanted a trip to Universal Studios with Coach at 50$. But the receptionists told us that Coach did not preform this trip anymore and we would have to go with another company at 68$ pr person. Coach did in fact do the tour and that made us really mad.  But the Hotel overall is generally a good buy!

Summary: The Comfort Inn & Suites is clean, quite reasonably priced, has quick and convenient service to the Disneyland resorts, a friendly staff, comfortable beds, good plumbing, efficient air conditioning and heating.  The only major downside was the malfunctioning in-room movie service, but management gave us the movie at no charge because of the problem. The doors and furniture are a bit worn but not distractingly so. The pool looked inviting but we didn't use it; the exercise room has just the basics.    The location is right on the edge of the business section, and except for a pleasant, small Thai restaurant, there are no restaurants (don't recommend the taco place across the street until they clean it!) nearby.  For visiting Disneyland on a budget, this is the place!
